Get all of your friend to pre-order!Every time one of your friends pre-orders a Paralenz camera on Indiegogo you receive a 25$ discount.For example: If you have pre-ordered the bargain Bargain Bird Perk, you need to get 16 successful referrals to get a full refund.
Get everyone you know to pre-order!The persons whose referrals has contributed the largest amount at the end of the campaign, wins an additional free Paralenz camera.

* Requirements & rulesYou must be a backer who have pre-ordered one of the Perk packages on Indiegogo, in order to participate.You can only receive a discount as large as the amount you have backed.The contest runs from  01/11/16 to 15/11/16.     Made for a purpose. No action camera is designed with the extreme demands of divers in mind. Until now.Reliable. As divers, we have high demands for the tools we depend on. We want a camera we can count on for quality recordings without worrying about it breaking or leaking.Tough. The underwater world is a tough place meant for tough people and tough products. Engineered by divers for divers. Inspired by our own dive gear we know that any product for diving has to be tough, easy to use, and able to go deep.So we've made the Paralenz Dive Camera in anodized aluminum and polycarbonate, with an easy-to-use two-button design, and with the ability to record at a depth of 200 m/656 ft.   Smart cam. To further enhance your dive experience the Paralenz Dive Camera has a pressure sensor for logging your dive in terms of depth and temperature, and for automatically adjusting the white balance according to your depth.  Worry-free recording. Paralenz Dive Camera is fully committed to make it as easy as possible to capture and share your dive. When diving you should not need to fumble with buttons or tweak irrelevant settings.
Is it only for diving? No, the Paralenz Dive Camera is perfectly capable of recording above water. Features designed for the extremes of diving also make recording easier above water.

Share the full experience. Equipped with a temperature and pressure sensor the Paralenz Dive Camera can log your dive and display your data together with your videos. At what depth did you see that manta ray? Now you know.
Intuitive navigation. Relive your dive by sliding easily through your dive data in the Paralenz App.

Navigating through your dive data Each dive has a specific dive log in the Paralenz App  Forget filters. With Paralenz you have no need for color filters. The Paralenz knows exactly how deep you are and adjusts your videos accordingly.  Colors underwater. As a diver you know that the deeper you go the more colors you loose. The first colors disappearing are red, orange and yellow. That's why most underwater footage captured below 10 m/33 ft. turns green. Auto white balance. The Paralenz Dive Camera is the first action camera in the world that automatically adjusts the white balance to match the depth you are at.   Snap Recording. Hold down the Activation Switch for 3 seconds and create a Snap Recording (short video clips) for quick and easy sharing. Adjust and share. When you return to the surface you can easily view your Snap Recordings on the Paralenz App. The Snap Recordings are automatically created. Adjust the beginning and length of the movie clip and share it with friends and family.Quick adjustment of Snap Recordings in the Paralenz App Share your Snap Recordings easily through the Paralenz App    Battery for hours. The Paralenz Dive Camera is insulated with Thermo foam minimizing battery discharge in cold water. In combination with the aluminum housing, it also makes the camera shockproof – so no worries if you drop it on the deck of a boat.   Go deep - very deep. Record and log your dives down to a depth of 200 meters / 656 feet. This camera is built to go deep. Pressure optimized. The most stable shape under pressure is that of a circle. A round housing made in aluminum with triple O-rings is a way of obtaining maximum depth performance. Use it with gloves. The large magnetic activation switch can be located by touch and is designed specifically to be used with neoprene diving gloves (tested with 7 mm neoprene gloves).No fumbling. We have based the Paralenz Dive Camera interface on a familiar design - the dive flashlight. This makes for intuitive use and easy location of buttons by touch.Screen. For easy access to depth, temperature, battery, time, and recording mode data, a 0.5"" display is located in the opposite end from the lens. Built-in toughness. There are so many benefits from not having to put your camera in an extra casing – lower weight, smaller size, no scratches on the inside of the dome port, and no fogging up of the lens. See more. Lots of sun and crystal clear water is not always the case, so the Paralenz Dive Camera has a sensor that is capable of filming in low light and murky waters. Smart buttons. Magnetic switch buttons have been used in diving gear for decades. By eliminating physical connection between the buttons and the internals of the Paralenz Dive Camera maximum waterproofness is ensured. High resolution. A top of the line processor and sensor delivers video in 4K Ultra HD, slow-motion in 4K – 30 FPS, 1080p – 100 FPS, 720p – 240 FPS, and 8 MP images. The resolution and frame rate are pre-selected in the Paralenz App. Easy mounting. The T-rail Click Mount located around the camera enables fast and easy mounting of all sorts of accessories. No need for tightening screws or bolts - the camera is locked safely in place.   1st person view. With the Paralenz Mask Mount, you can easily capture video from your own point of view. Physical feedback. When activating the Activation Switch a small vibration can be felt in the camera. In this way you always know when you have activated the camera.Muscles and brains. The Paralenz Dive Camera is not only tough but packs the best camera specs.   No shaky videos. Built-in EIS (Electronic Image Stabilization) reduces the majority of vibrations in your footage and causes videos recorded on a shaky bike ride or while running to be much more enjoyable. No fish-eye. Action cameras are notorious for their videos with a funny bulgy look. But not Paralenz. The camera’s software corrects the distortion and flattens your videos.Smartphone friendly. The Paralenz App will be free to download for both iOS and Android.View and share. With the Paralenz App on your phone or tablet, you can view and quickly edit your videos, Snap Recordings, and photos. Upload them directly to Facebook or Instagram – no need to use a computer or open the camera.Camera settings. In the Paralenz App you can also change various settings such as video and image resolution, frame rate, video overlay etc. Your dive. The Paralenz Mask Mount is designed to fit all common diving masks - just slide it onto the strap of your mask. Can be used on both left and right side of your mask. Slide it forward to allow bubbles to go behind the camera when filming. Use existing accessories. The Paralenz Universal Mount enables you to use most existing accessories.The Paralenz Mounts snaps easily to the Paralenz Dive Camera. Watch yourself dive. There is nothing better than capturing beautiful fish, hidden shipwrecks, or colorful corals. But you often forget to show that you yourself were also present. With the Paralenz 3rd Person Viewer now you can.It's behind you! The Paralenz 3rd Person Viewer is mounted on your BC and films you from behind. Pictures of early 3rd Person Viewer prototypes. The two pontoons create the necessary buoyancy. Study your technique. Being able to study your own technique is a huge help for new divers. How is your position in the water, are you using your body in the right way? Study yourself and become a better diver.     Design, test, repeat. Designing the Paralenz Dive Camera is the story about rapid prototyping, user tests, and a thorough design process. All design choices have been put to the test and tweaked for optimal performance. Have a look at our design process below.

Full-time developers. Paralenz ApS is a team of dedicated product developers, who also happen to be divers. We are a start-up focusing exclusively on the development and sales of diving equipment.The company. Paralenz ApS is a branch of the innovation agency MOEF, which has developed products for more than 15 years. MOEF is also behind WaterWolf, an underwater camera designed for anglers. It has become very successful and has won both design and product awards in 2014, 15 and 16.  Stay up to date. Follow Paralenz on Facebook and Instagram for product and manufacturing updates, new product ideas, and news from the Paralenz Team.Facebook: www.facebook.com/paralenzInstagram: www.instagram.com/paralenzWeb: www.paralenz.com Share the deep. Tag your dive videos and pictures with the official Paralenz hashtag #sharethedeep. We would love to see your diving adventures!",86.0,1,"1 Campaign

I want to take more photography but without a new hard drive and gear upgrade I'm at a stop. My finances are tied up right now due to lack of regular work and a new hard drive and camera gear is not in my budget. I am in hopes of turning to all of you beautiful people that I have photographed through the years. Help me raise money for a new hard drive so I can continue to produce new work. Thank you for your time and genoerousity.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

COSYSPEED is a Germany based company that is focussed on gear for mirrorless cameras. In 2015 we successfully funded the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic on Indiegogo, a camera bag for street photographers. Visit www.cosyspeed.com for more info.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

A Camera Bag for outdoor-active Photographers

Do you like to go hiking, climbing, biking, horse riding or travelling? And do you want to have your cam at the ready within a second, but safe against rain and bumps at the same time? Then the COSYSPEED CAMSLINGER Outdoor might be the right camera bag for you!

Put in your Mirrorless, mid-sized DSLR or Superzoom and hit the trail. The CAMSLINGER Outdoor is super quick accessible, super comfy and super safe.

 

Photos by Stephan Wienser

 

The 1-hand/1-second concept

When you use a CAMSLINGER Outdoor you can access your camera super quick. Just move your hand intuitively to the bag at your hip, open it, grab the cam and take your picture - all with one hand and within a second. This 1-hand/1-second concept makes the CAMSLINGER the fastest camera bag in the world!

 

Do you use a sling strap?

Many photographers use a sling strap. You too? Are you amazed by the speed of the one-handed access to your camera? But on the other side you would wish to have your gear safe against rain and bumps when not in use? 

 

The super comfy way of carrying your Camera

A CAMSLINGER Outdoor is super comfy to wear even the whole day long. When used at the hip, your back is free of any weight! When used as a sling bag over your shoulder, you still have all the features like the quick, one-handed access.

The CAMSLINGER has a fixed belt and is free movable around your hip.

 

The carrying position of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor is low on the thigh. Hence it is super intuitively accessible. The construction works like a hinge and so the weight of your gear is super comfy on your thigh and not on your waist.

 

What gear fits in a CAMSLINGER Outdoor?
• Lenses (when using a sling strap for your cam)
• 190 mm (w) x 160 mm"" (h) x 95 mm to 110 mm (d) due to flexible back
• 7.5"" (w) x 6.3"" (h) x 3.7"" to 4.3"" (d) due to flexible back

Safety against dropping – the FINGERSTRAP

To have your camera safe against accidential dropping and at the same time ready without delay (as you would have a delay when attaching a strap around your neck or wrist) we developped the FINGERSTRAP. It comes free with every CAMSLINGER Outdoor and is easily attachable without any loss of time.

Attach intuitively and without any loss of time when grabing your camera

 

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor can be worn at the hip or over the shoulder. The fixed belt can be adjusted from 75 cm to 125 cm / 30"" to 50"" and can be extended to 165 cm / 65"" with the optional BELTEXTENSION 40. It is made out of durable and weather proof NYLON 900D fabrics and will be available in two colors:

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor S. Wiesner Edition

Stephan Wiesner is a photographer, author, vlogger and climber based in Bern/Switzerland. He supported us profoundly in the development of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor and is a long time user of COSYSPEED products.

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor S. Wiesner Edition is available only in this crowd-funding campaign and so is a limited edition. It has a small stitching of the signature of Stephan on the front. The S. Wiesner Edition is 20 $US more expensive. The extra 20 $US will flow into a project of our German partner organisation Burundikids e.V.. Burundikids is a NGO that helps refugees and street kids in Burundi/Africa. 

The particular project you'll support when backing for the S. Wiesner Edition is the Mother-Child-House in the capital Bujumbura. Young homeless mothers and their babys/kids can get a place to sleep, food, health care and education in the Centre Nyubahiriza. Stephan relinquishes on any profits out of this project in favour to support Burundikids.

For more information please visit www.burundikids.org

 

Stretch-Goal

When we reach 25,000 $US, we will also produce a green Version of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor. If you've backed the grey or blue one and the stretch-goal of 25,000 US is reached, you can change the color to green by sending us a short note
column2:
-)

 

Lots of space for accessories

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor offers lots of space for accessories like spare batteries, SD-cards etc. Six compartment dividers let you customize the inside to your needs.

It also offers an included raincover, which is stored in the bottom of the bag.

The included thigh band can be used to fix the CAMSLINGER Outdoor on your thigh, which might be usefull when you are horse riding for example. The CAMSLINGER Outdoor has two loops on the bottom, which can be used for this, and two on the top, which can be used to fix the CAMSLINGER at your backpack for example.

Together with German fastener specialist Fidlock, we developed a smart new closure. It works with magnets and is super quick and easy to open. When closed it is locked safely in its place.

 

BELTEXTENSION 40

As an accessory to extend the belt of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor, the BELTEXTENSION 40 will be available as a perk. The BELTEXTENSION 40 will extend to 165 cm/65"" simply by clicking on the belt.

 

What others say about the COSYSPEED CAMSLINGER concept

STEVE HUFF – ""It’s so comfortable to wear as well as beeing 100% functional that it was a pleasure to wear and walk around with.”

UDI TIROSH – “One awesome family photography travel bag!”

THOMAS LEUTHARD – “The ultimate bag for the mirrorless hero.”

MIRROR LESSONS – “The CAMSLINGERs are an easy and practical solution, and above all, a joy to use. I cannot imagine setting out on a photography outing or assignment without one anymore.”

HERBERT PIEL – “There are really not much accessories that I would recommend with conviction, but now here comes the CAMSLINGER…”

KROLOP &
column3:
GERST – “The CAMSLINGER is just insanely good!”

STREETHUNTERS.NET – “The Cosyspeed Camslinger Camera Bag is a fine product that I enjoy using very much. After a month it has become my number one choice for when I hit the streets…”

 

Schedule

September 2015 to October 2016 prototyping and testing 

November 2016 production ready of the prototypes

December 2016 to February 2017 Crowd-Funding

February 2017 to May 2017 production of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor

June/July (due to a production delay) 2017 shipping to the backers

 

Risks and Challanges

The CAMSLINGER Outdoor is an already ready-to-production product and will be manufactured as soon as the campaign is successfully completed. The production-ready-prototypes are already tested by Stephan Wiesner and other photographers and do work without any problem. As COSYSPEED has already several products in production, and we already funded a campaign on Indiegogo. we can access an already well working chain of high quality manufacturing, shipment and distribution. 

Our manufacturer (certified by Bureau Veritas) is located in the Chinese Shenzen area and run by a German manufacturing company. It is guaranteed that quality is on a very high standard and that all workers are working under very good and proven conditions. 

With a successful Indiegogo campaign in the back there are in our opinion no real risks. Only serious circumstances are a risk, such as natural desasters or a deep economic crisis.  

The main challenge is to make this campaign a success. And with your help and recommandations it is realistic that we can master this amazing project :-)

 

Team &
column4:
Thanks :-)

Thomas Ludwig, CEO and founder of COSYSPEED

Thomas Ludwig has had an advertising agency in Germany for almost 20 years and was working as development aid worker for the German Development Service in African countries. He is a photo nerd since many years and has a passion for street photography (but not much time for it). He lives with his family near Hamburg/Germany.

At first glance this seems to be a rather small team, but there are many more in the background who were involved into this project. So it's time to say THANKS!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

First of all I'd like to thanks Stephan Wiesner. I'm still overwhelmed by his kindness and constant support in the development process of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor. This product wouldn't exist in this way without his help. Stephan is not just one super nice and reliable guy, he is also an amazing photographer, author and vlogger.

Please vistit his webiste: http://www.stephanwiesner.de/blog/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sportportraits

YouTube channel:  https://www.youtube.com/user/fotografietutorial/

My next thanks goes to Andrea, Patrick and Steve from www.43rumors.com, www.sonyalpharumors.com, www.canonwatch.com and www.fujirumors.com as well as their readers. They presented this project in an early stage to their community and we got about 60(!) ideas and suggestions for the CAMSLINGER Outdoor. Many of them flowed in the final product and the bag wouldn't be so great without your support! Many thanks guys!!! :-)

Bernhard and Mamba who are in charge of our EU and US logistics were always a huge support and will be when the CAMSLINGER Outdoor is about to ship. Many thanks :-)

Thanks to Horst for the general support and assistance!!!

Thanks to awesome PROBIS, Hamburg for the photos of cams in the CAMSLINGER Outdoor we made in their studio!!   

Thanks to the amazing team of Foto+Digital Gressung, Saarbrücken, for their ideas and support!!!

Thanks to Hanna and Sammi from the design and manufacturing team for their constant and constructive support.

Last but not least a HUGE thanks goes to my wonderful wife Friederike and sweet little daughter Elfriede and cute baby Alwin for being so patient and supporting a super crazy photo bag guy :-)

And many thanks to all you guys that are not mentioned here. All of you wonderful peeps out there are part of this project and without you we won't be where we are.

 

FAQs

When do you ship the CAMSLINGER Outdoor?

Shipping starts by the end of April or beginning of May 2017 and we hope to get all CAMSLINGERs to backers in May 2017.

Do I have to pay customs or VAT or shipping?

We are shipping from warehouses/distributors in the US and Germany. So in these countries (and the EU) you dont have to pay customs. In other countries it might be, that you have to pay customs depending on the particular customs regulations in your country.

VAT is basically included in every shipping respectively is not applicable inmany destinations. 

Shipping will be added when checking out. Depending on your country, it will be between 4,90 $US and 19,90 $US.

What kind of company is COSYSPEED and what will you do with the money raised in this campaign?

COSYSPEED GmbH is a German company (Ltd.) based near Frankfurt/Germany. The money from this campaign will be used for the manufacturing of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor bags.

What will happen to my money if you do not reach the goal of 12.000 $US

We are using the flexible option wich allows to collect the backed money even if the targeted 12.000 $US will not be reached. However we would start the manufacturing process if we reach 9.000 $US and will ship as planned in May. If we do not reach 9.000 $US, we will refund the collected money to the backers.

DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN YOU'D LIKE TO BE ANSWERED? JUST DROP US SOME LINES...

In other countries it might be, that you have to pay customs depending on the particular customs regulations in your country.VAT is basically included in every shipping respectively is not applicable inmany destinations. Shipping will be added when checking out. Depending on your country, it will be between 4,90 $US and 19,90 $US.What kind of company is COSYSPEED and what will you do with the money raised in this campaign?COSYSPEED GmbH is a German company (Ltd.) based near Frankfurt/Germany. The money from this campaign will be used for the manufacturing of the CAMSLINGER Outdoor bags.What will happen to my money if you do not reach the goal of 12.000 $USWe are using the flexible option wich allows to collect the backed money even if the targeted 12.000 $US will not be reached. However we would start the manufacturing process if we reach 9.000 $US and will ship as planned in May. If we do not reach 9.000 $US, we will refund the collected money to the backers.DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN YOU'D LIKE TO BE ANSWERED? JUST DROP US SOME LINES...",20.0,0,"5 Campaigns
>

column6: >
column16:
>

The real thing - just like a pro DSLR!

Electronically calibrated to provide maximum sensitivity, just like a traditional DSLR. Pictar’s shutter button offers a ""half press"" mode to lock focus and exposure for easy tracking of a moving object or to create a desired composition, as well as full-press for immediate shutter release. The button is located right under the index finger to enable precise and intuitive shooting, with one hand.

Tip: if you're shooting in a cold environment, or taking pictures of extreme sports, you'll be happy to learn that with Pictar's shutter button you can now take pictures on an iPhone with your gloves!
column17: >
column19:
>
 

Zoom with only one hand.

Located right below the shutter release button, the rotating zoom ring does away with the need to touch the screen to pinch-and-zoom, and makes it easy for the user to zoom in and out with just one hand. The zoom ring can also be re-programmed by user to suit specific needs, such as the flash, white-balance, etc. if that's the case, zoom in or out will be done by ""pinching"" the iPhone's screen, like before.
column22:
>
 

Let the fun begin!

Clicking the zoom ring will switch between the iPhone's front and back camera for easy ""selfie"" shots. Like the rotation of the zoom ring, the button can also be re-programmed by user to suit specific needs and control other settings.

Tip: Changed to ""selfie"" mode? Shooting one-handed? You can use the zoom ring for perfect composition, and shoot pictures you'll love to share.
column26:
>
 

Control light like never before!

Strategically located in the right corner is the exposure compensation wheel, which lets the user quickly and easily control brightness level even before shooting. And just like with an advanced camera, the exposure compensation wheel changes the exposure in steps of 1/3 aperture, and the clear display appears at the bottom of the iPhone screen.

Tip: In manual mode, the exposure compensation wheel changes its designation and allows control of ISO values.
column29:
>
 

Fully customizable, the smart wheel allows users to control a variety of functions.
column30:
>

Beginners will love the ease of control - in default mode the smart wheel controls 7 pre-set modes, which enable users to easily adjust the iPhone to any situation while focusing on actually taking the shot. Pre-set modes are:

column1: Advanced photographers will feel right at home: the smart wheel lets you choose between 3 advanced modes:

column4:
>

The Virtual Wheel is another great feature that allows the user to control different modes such as Flash modes, Shutter speed, ISO and more - simply by using his thumb. Switching between modes is done by using the Smart Wheel.
column6:
>

Feel like you're holding a real camera

The iPhone is an amazing design icon, and we as designers are full of admiration for the people who brought it to the world - but let's face it: as a camera, it's nowhere near the comfort, safe feel and familiar grip of a traditional camera. So the second task we undertook - after developing advanced controls - was to design an ergonomic grip that would sit comfortably in one hand and let you take one-handed shots while holding it out the window of a speeding jeep. And we believe we did it!
column7:
>

Pictar's grip is coated with anti-slip material and gives you something solid to grasp on one hand, while being compact enough to provide what we love about smartphones - accessibility and ease of storage. Pictar lets you take one-handed shots, anywhere, without falling out of your grasp. It provides sharp images thanks to the steady grip. We think it also looks great, with its trendy retro design inspired by classic cameras we love. Your iPhone will love it.
column10:
>

Saves time looking for your iPhone so you'll never miss a shot or have your precious phone fall. 

It's rare to see a camera that isn't connected to a strap. So when we developed Pictar, we knew we wanted to design not one but two straps: a wrist strap to secure it against falling, and a neck strap for carrying. The classic Pictar kit offers a standard adjustable wrist strap with a fast connection clasp. The Pictar-Plus kit includes a neck strap too - which also connects to the same fast connection clasp.

Tip: You can easily change between them or disconnect them both.
column16:
>

The padded case will keep your PICTAR safe when not in use.
column20:
>

Easily connect any tripod, for sharper than ever images
column21:
>

The mobile-camera revolution enables anyone to go out into the wild - jungle or city - armed with just an iPhone. There they discover that they sometimes lack a trusty buddy - a tripod. There are many ways to improvise, but you won't always find a convenient tree or flat rock to stabilize the iPhone when you really could use a tripod.

That's why it was important to us to incorporate a standard 1/4"" thread in Pictar, just like real cameras have.
column26:
>

Stable and reliable cold-shoe connector - for many camera accessory - not just iPhone oriented.

The market offers an endless choice of LED-based lighting devices which add a fascinating dimension of light to the creative process. The problem is that many of them - especially the professional ones - are designed to be connected to real cameras with a standard upper connection. So Pictar offers a reliable and stable cold-shoe connection to hook up anything you want - via Pictar - to your iPhone.

NOTE:

column1: • PICTAR's App does not support hand-held flash units.
• The cold shoe mount can support lighting units weighs up to 300 gr. / 0,66 pounds.
• Due to the fact that while it attached to PICTAR, the iPhone's connecting jack is concealed - any device that is using the connecting jack must be disconnected before actual attachment to PICTAR.

column4:
>

Pictar's semi-open body allows connecting most ""clip-on"" lenses. We've tested it with olloclip lens, and it works great.
column7:
>

A powerful, dedicated app featuring patented high-frequency dual tone sound control.

Pictar is designed to communicate with iPhone via a dedicated camera app which unlocks key features inaccessible on the native app to iPhone users. Each of the physical controls found on Pictar drive a specific function or setting and does so using high-frequency dual tone sounds. 

Each physical control is assigned a specific tone, and with each turn of a dial, press of a button or turn of a wheel, Pictar emits a sound that – when detected by the app – generates a corresponding action. The high-frequency dual tone (18,500 – 20,000 khz) is inaudible to the human ear and significantly increases battery life when compared to Bluetooth connectivity.
column8:
>

Using a standard CR ½ AA battery, we estimates 4-6 months of use before the need to replace the power source is required.
column9:
>

We are offering two almost identical models who share the same features. PICTAR fits iPhone models 4 to 6S while PICTAR PLUS fits iPhone 6 PLUS and iPhone  6S PLUS.

column6: >Perhaps one of the biggest challenges in the development process was how to let as many iPhone users benefit from Pictar, without making it too expensive by adding various adapters. The solution consists of two elements:

column1: 1: Wireless connection between Pictar and the iPhone using high-frequency sound waves (see separate chapter)
column2:
2: A modular mechanical connection to connect different model iPhones of different sizes. The result - Pictar fits most existing iPhone models, and is ready for future models. If any backer plans to upgrade one day to a new model iPhone - chances are that it will fit.

Tip: If you have numerous iPhones in the family, you can share Pictar without a problem by installing Pictar-Up (free) on all devices.
column3:
>

Can I use my iPhone cover with Pictar?

Pictar’s semi-open body design doesn't allow to connect a case while attaching the iPhone. 

The only exception is the iPhone 6 / 6s that can be fitted with a silicon case - similar to Apple’s original “Silicon Case”.
column4:
>

And what about Pictar for Android?

The decision to develop Pictar for iPhone only was not easy, and it required a lot of thought and long discussions into the night. In the end we have our reasons:

1. Development of app and operating system: Thanks to Apple's unified OS it was easier for us to develop software for iPhone than Android, so we decided to focus the project to avoid wasting resources and valuable time.

 2. The physical size - the iPhone comes in a limited number of models. Android phones come in so many different shapes, sizes and thicknesses, it was easier for our designers to develop a body that fits most iPhone models then to tackle countless Android models.

3. Focus! The Pictar project was extremely challenging - even for companies much bigger than miggo. So it was important for us to focus only on iPhones so we could come up with a production-ready prototype as quickly as possible - and make it as good as can be. Diversification on many platforms would have diverted us from our goal.
column8: >
column14: >
column16: >
column17: >
column18: >
column19:
>

From dream to reality
column20:
>

Eighteen months ago, Guy - one of the miggo partners - stole two hours of breathing space between meetings in New York to travel to the Ground Zero memorial site. Guy is an avid photographer but he left his DSLR in the office, so all he had on him to document the exciting site was his iPhone. The images he was able to shoot frustrated him to the point that he decided that the next miggo project will be an advanced grip-control for iPhone photographers.

Fast-forward 6 months: the miggo team prepare first sketches and begin to formulate designs. Very quickly we realized we were looking for a grip that will provide external control of the advanced and powerful iPhone camera. The process included searching for a suitable design concept of the Pictar body - one that resembled a camera without being too cumbersome.

At the same time we carried out a proper characterization of camera features which we would like to control externally: exposure, zoom, electronic shutter release, and more. Design took shape quite quickly - we knew from the start that it would look and feel like a classic camera. We examined a large number of sketches till we finally focused on the current direction. As you can see in the pictures, the process eventually led to the final result that we really love.
column21:
>

The next stage was the most difficult - how to make the external buttons operate the iPhone camera without a physical connection? The easiest solution - Bluetooth - was thrown out due to its tendency to ""hog"" power like there's no tomorrow, from both the iPhone itself and the grip.
column22: >
column23: >
column24:
>

A surprising solution came from an engineer who worked with us - using high-frequency sound waves of 18500-20000 kHz. The idea is that each external control emits a dual frequency when operated, that isn't detected by the human ear. Frequency duplication distinguishes between the frequencies produced by Pictar and similar frequencies that exist in the environment, thus avoiding false commands.

The specialized operating system we developed receives the frequencies and translates them into an order that results in an action. The great advantage of the system is its zero power consumption. A standard CR ½ AA battery in Pictar can last for up to 6 months, with reasonable use.
column25:
>

The picture above shows ""Albert"" - the experimental motherboard specially designed to simulate what Pictar knows how to do today. Clicking on each of the five buttons activating a high frequency which controlled the camera.

While developing the voice system, we designed a dedicated app in collaboration with one of the best companies in the country. The app - free of course - offers even more control in terms of what the iPhone camera allows.

We also added straps and a padded pouch to keep everything nice and safe, and we were ready to go. So this is it - we are ready to manufacture and hope for the best. Looking back - this past year was exciting, challenging and especially intense for the development team, but the result is worth it all.
column27:
>

You may ask who we are and why are we here for the 3rd time?! Thanks for asking!
column28:
>

Frankly, we believe in Kickstarter.

We believe the crowd funding is the best way for a small and ambitious company like us to quickly and efficiently reach the people for whom we work so hard to develop breakthrough products.

We like to listen.

Kickstarter is a wonderful place to hear exactly what people think about your product - long before it reaches the market. Just think about it - this is the best, largest and most professional focus group in the world! Your knowledge is invaluable and what's really cool is that people are happy to share their knowledge and experience - to help developers like us bring to market products that might not have been developed using the traditional way.

These are just some of the reasons we're here for the third time. This, and the adrenaline rush the campaign gives us, after so much hard work developing a product that we totally believe in.

We were here 2 years ago with our strap&
column29:
wrap - the world's first camera strap that morphs into a compact protective carrier. The campaign raised 400% above target and our young company received a huge infusion of energy to continue developing innovative products.

A year ago we were back again with agua - an ipx3 storm-proof quick-draw camera holster - this time we raised 800% of what we asked for, with only 2000 amazing backers. It gave us a lot of confidence and resources to continue.

In the 3 years that miggo has been around, we have developed over 10 new products with Kickstarter, and these products have been successfully sent to all backers and are also sold in over 30 countries around the world - in four different continents.

Dear Kickstarter backers,

We've come back to ask for your support again - help us bring Pictar to production and lend us a hand in changing the world of photography.

Please join us by supporting Pictar or sharing this page with your friends and family. Any help will be appreciated for ever!

Thank YOU!

Team miggo

column1: We are a company from Croatia that already has a patented unique product for wireless control of video cameras.

Our aim is the construction, design and development of new electronic devices for widespread use, the reason for launching this campaign is raising funds to start production of our new and unique control for Panasonic video cameras.

Our controller is based on the concept of analog digital combination controlled microprocessor with sophisticated software solution to all these mentioned advantages that have not been possible. Controller has a 2.5 mm jack and 3.5 mm jack connector for control.
By using this controller, code named ""PaRe"" (Panasonic Remote), new possibilities in video production and all forms of video recording are opened.

Advantages of our controller in relation to other controllers on the market are:
- Precise focusing,
- Limiting the focus points,
- Memorizing the positions of focus,
- simple call the position of focus from memory with time transition (0.2 / 0.5 / 1/2 or more seconds)
- Aperture control also with the possibility of limiting the desired value.
- Speed ​​management functions of the camera

Our controller is based on the concept of analog digital combination controlled microprocessor with sophisticated software solution to all these mentioned advantages that have not been possible. Controller has a 2.5 mm jack and 3.5 mm jack connector for control.
By using this controller, codenamed ""PaRe"" (Panasonic Remote), new possibilities in video production and all forms of video recording are opened.

Funds raised through this campaign will be invested in launching series production of this controller:
-making computer cases for controller
-fabrication of printed circuit boards for electronics PCB
-Cable production
-Programming and testing new software possibilities
-purchase of electronic and mechanical components
-fabrication of high-quality packaging for controller
-composition and product testing
-Packing and distribution
-increased production capacity
Shipping is free for all backers around the world!
The warranty on our products is one year!

column2: Focus Controller is a powerful accessory for CamFi wireless controller. It works with different lenses and cameras, even manual lens. CamFi ZF can be connected with CamFi CF101, CF102, CamFi Pro and CamFi Pro Plus via USB cable. Photographers can use the CamFi mobile app to control the CamFi ZF for zooming or focusing via WiFi.

column1: It also supports “live view” preview for composing. It is able to trigger the photo capturing and start/stop video recording remotely.

Just set the nearest focus point and the farthest focus point via the app. It can move the focus from near to far and automatically take a series of photos during the movement. Manual lenses and some cameras that use third party lenses can work with this device as well.
Set the two points for zooming via the app. After tapping the start button, it will control the camera to “shoot-move-shoot” automatically.
Whether it is A7M3 + 24-70mm combination, or 1Dx ii + 16-400mm, you can easily control it. Wide-angle, telephoto, macro, auto focus lens, manual focus lens, all can be used.
CamFi ZF adopts high-precsion stepper motor which has full torque, can easily drive large zoom lenses.
CamFi ZF's modular design makes assembly easier. By using carbon fibre material, the device is light weight and strong.

Founded in 2015, CamFi focuses on developing camera control and photo transmission products. In 2018 CamFi launched CamFi Pro, the world's first 5.8g Wi-Fi camera wireless controller, and also had a successful crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo. Building on this, CamFi launched CamFi Pro Plus, the first wireless camera controller in the world that can control Capture One and Lightroom wirelessly. CamFi has been repeatedly reported by the famous camera media DPreview, FPhoto.

The CamFi ZF Remote Zoom&Focus Controller is a powerful accessory for CamFi wireless controller. It works with different lenses and cameras, even manual lens. CamFi ZF can be connected with CamFi CF101, CF102, CamFi Pro and CamFi Pro Plus via USB cable. Photographers can use the CamFi mobile app to control the CamFi ZF for zooming or focusing via WiFi.
It also supports “live view” preview for composing. It is able to trigger the photo capturing and start/stop video recording remotely.

Just set the nearest focus point and the farthest focus point via the app. It can move the focus from near to far and automatically take a series of photos during the movement. Manual lenses and some cameras that use third party lenses can work with this device as well.
Set the two points for zooming via the app. After tapping the start button, it will control the camera to “shoot-move-shoot” automatically.
Whether it is A7M3 + 24-70mm combination, or 1Dx ii + 16-400mm, you can easily control it. Wide-angle, telephoto, macro, auto focus lens, manual focus lens, all can be used.
CamFi ZF adopts high-precsion stepper motor which has full torque, can easily drive large zoom lenses.
CamFi ZF's modular design makes assembly easier. By using carbon fibre material, the device is light weight and strong.

Hi. My name is Phil McBride, but I also go by the name FLiP Shots when I'm out shooting bands.

I've been a live music photographer for 7 years now, and it is my biggest passion. Atleast it was until disaster struck last year (2013).

Whilst shooting local band Z Stacks for the first time, I noticed my lens was acting up. And by the end of the gig the auto focus was completely shot and would not function. I was devastated. The lens has since become unusable.

At first I blamed it on the awesome power of Z Stacks, but the reality is the lens I used has a common fault that Canon have never admitted as a known fault, meaning when the fault eventually rears it's ugly head, Canon do not offer any form of known fault repair warranty or assistance. And to repair the lens, it's about the same cost as replacing it.

As a result I was left without my main lens for shooting gigs. I do have two other lenses, but neither are suitable for the type of work I produce as one is a fixed focus, and the other is a zoom, neither of which have a wide angle, or even begin to compare image quality wise to my now deceased lens.

So why do I want your help?
Well, since starting my music photography, I have never asked for a penny from the bands I shoot. I always ensure I send the bands final copies of the images to use royalty
free, and always advertise the bands as much as possible post gig. In summary, my goal in all of this is to feed my passion, but also
help to promote the talented musicians to get the coverage and advertising they

deserve. All for free. Since losing my lens, I have not been able to do any of this. The loss of the lens was also a huge blow to not only my confidence, but also my ability to do what I love. So here's where you can come in.

Help me to meet my goal, replace my lens, get back out there, and get shooting again!

Every penny counts, and while I can't offer much, I can offer my eternal thanks and gratitude.

The lens I plan to purchase as a replacement to my broken lens is the Canon EF-S 17-55 f/2.8 IS USM Lens, currently retailing around £600.

Digital or analog? No need to choose, you have both.

The first low-cost digital back for your 35mm camera. For those who always wanted to have a ""hybrid"" camera working with photographic films or in digital mode. 

 

Hi! I'm Samuel Mello Medeiros, and after 5 years and dozens of prototypes later, I'm Back® launches its final version, with a leaner design, an elegant bayonet docking system and with dedicated back covers for each of the most important brands

Nikon F, Nikon F2, Nikon F3, Nikon FA, Nikon EM, Nikon FG, Nikkormat EL,  Nikon FM, Nikon FE, Nikon S2, Canon F1, Canon A1, Canon AE1, Canon FT, Pentax ME super, Pentax spotomatic, Pentax K1000, Praktica b200, Praktica MTL, Contax II, Contax RTS, Contax G2, Olympus OM1, Olympus OM2, Olympus OM4, Olympus OM10, Minolta Dinaxx 7000, Minolta XD series, Yashica JP, Yashica FX3, Leica M, Leica R, Diana F, Diana F mini, Ricoh.

 

What if your camera is not in the above list? Do not worry! I have also created a universal accessory, which can be adjusted to almost all 35mm cameras. So if you have a Zenit, Alpa or other brand, you also will be able to use I'm Back®.

>Video by Pentax ME Super 50mm f1.7 + Im Back®

 

I love photography, be it analogue or digital, and I love the great cameras that, by a sudden change of technology, ended up being archived and forgotten inside a box or drawer. So I couldn't stop thinking how to revive those wonderful vintage 35mm cameras.


""It was during a hot summer night"" that I dreamed the I'm Back® device... 

After a few years of hard work and thousands of photos later, it's now possible to take your old camera out of the drawer, shoot pictures and even take videos in a very simple and quick way, with the same vintage flavour. The joy of joys is that I kept costs very low, not using large sensors, but through a system called ""image photo over the focusing screen"" and therefore the entire 24x36 area is optimised and digitally recorded.

 

What they are talking about:

""All I can say is “may God bless you”. I have been waiting 20 years for this product. I want one-where can I buy this wonderful piece of technology?I was a professional photographer in the 1970s. I have a wonderful (and very expensive) Canon F-1 system that I used for many years producing some beautiful shots. When the digital cameras came out, I tried a few and was frustrated and disappointed with the results (I was no longer a professional at that time). Now, with your brilliant I’m Back, I will be back working with my Canon F-1 and taking wonderful photos again! Thank you.""

Tampa Florida USA - www.imback.eu - March 12, 2018

""Ciao ho una Nikon f3, il vostro progetto mi entusiasma..."" G.L. - www.imback.eu - October 24, 2017

""I am glad someone like you have such a great idea. I have a couple of old Camera pass on from my dad, I would love to able to reuse them or give that back to him with your devices, he would be so happy.""A.A. Kickstarter member - October 24, 2017

""Hope you make it. Looks like the old Forsher Polaroid back for 35mm testing in the old days . Fabulous .""J.M. From my iPhone - October 22, 2017

""Hi, Congratulation for jour product. You are make my dream.""S.F. - www.imback.eu - August 02, 2017

""Just saw your video clip - amazing! I have 35mm SLRs and lenses collections which are sitting in storage for several years..."" Y.W. - www.imback.eu - June 30, 2017

""oh wow! magnific idea. Does it work for Nikon F100 Hope yes, please answer soon to support asap kickstarter campaign"" R.D. - Enquirer - www.imback.eu - March 17, 2017

Who are talking about us...

 

The design of this product is called ""Depth-of-field"" (DoF) adapter. In normal digital cameras, the image from the lens is directly projected onto the sensor. So the smaller the size of the sensor, the more the image is cropped which we call crop factor. In this DoF adapter ""digital back"", the image is projected onto the focusing screen.  And then we use a digital camera to take a photo of this focusing screen. There is no crop factor. 

 

I'm Back® offers a 16mp Panasonic sensor that provides pictures and movies of 20, 16, 12, 8, 4, 2 mega pixels at your choice! Thanks to the focusing screen it will always maintain the nice vintage flavor of your 35mm camera. A smart 2"" touch screen display is included, making the device very user-friendly. Photos and videos can be transmitted through the WiFi and can be saved in your smartphone. You can also use the display of your smartphone, to have a bigger screen and to control the camera through it.

The result, as you can see in the photos published here, is something very special: although it is digital, it keeps the genuine flavor of your vintage camera. I'm Back® is unique in its kind
column6:
an extremely affordable solution to use your fantastic analogue photo-camera in a digital way. 

Try it! And, whenever you want, you can pull-off the back, put a roll of photographic films of your choice and shoot analogue photos like in the 1950s! I'm Back® joins the best of both worlds, analog and digital!

I listened to all the comments and suggestions of the main photography forums on earth, and thanks to them I realised a new design resulting in a leaner, better and more functional device. I improved it with a small display and therefore the use of a smartphone is not necessary.

column12: >New and simple system to fit and lock the camera through two lateral clamps
column15: >Bayonet system. Easier way to attach the camera to the I'm Back
column20:
>Dedicated covers are created for better ergonomics, dust protection and eventual light input. Just one I'm Back and you can fit the camera you want!

No more dark edges. Now you can use smaller diaphragm openings that, thanks to the software, will lead your photos without dark edges. 

 

I'm Back was intended for... 

for those who want to have fun and are tired to discuss about high resolutions and megapixels!!! Yes, because the magic about taking a photo is to study it, to click and why not, to make ""mistakes"", take it again and conceive a unique photo by analysing carefully the shape and not just caring about technology, as we used to do when we had only 36 poses clicking only when we were convinced to be ready.  I'm Back®. For those who love art.

May not be suitable for professional photographers who wish to maximise the number of pixels in an image

column11:
> 

For more images:

 

 

 

 

 

What I’m Back is not: 

It is not a substitution to film rolls. It is not invasive since all it takes is to take off the back cover of the camera therefore you can always go back to take analog pictures. It is not a competitor against other digital cameras. The main objective of I’m Back s to urge the return of the old and perfectly functioning analog cameras with the possibility to see in real time the result of the pictures you take (as other digital cameras do).

 

 

CREDITS:

* Project progress icons - designed by Flaticon Vectors Market

* Nikon F3, Nikon FA, Nikon EM, Nikon FG, Nikkormat EL, Nikon F, Nikon F2, Nikon FM, Nikon FE, Nikon S2, Canon F1, Canon A1, Canon AE1, Pentax ME super, Canon FT, Minolta XD series, Pentax spotomatic, Pentax K1000, Praktica b200, Praktica MTL, Contax II, Contax RTS , Contax G2, Olympus OM1, Olympus OM2, Minolta Dinaxx 7000, Olympus OM10, Yashica JP, Yashica FX3, Leica M, Leica R, Diana F, Diana F mini,  Raspberry Pi are a trademarks.

 

Risks and challenges

Delivery times may differ significantly due to the production lead times, nevertheless, like I did in my past campaigns, I'm improving the entire supply chain process which is much leaner now. The PCB and the sensors may differ from the one showed at the pictures above, nevertheless the resolution and quality will be necessarily equal or higher.

The main objective of I’m Back s to urge the return of the old and perfectly functioning analog cameras with the possibility to see in real time the result of the pictures you take (as other digital cameras do).  CREDITS:* Project progress icons - designed by Flaticon Vectors Market* Nikon F3, Nikon FA, Nikon EM, Nikon FG, Nikkormat EL, Nikon F, Nikon F2, Nikon FM, Nikon FE, Nikon S2, Canon F1, Canon A1, Canon AE1, Pentax ME super, Canon FT, Minolta XD series, Pentax spotomatic, Pentax K1000, Praktica b200, Praktica MTL, Contax II, Contax RTS , Contax G2, Olympus OM1, Olympus OM2, Minolta Dinaxx 7000, Olympus OM10, Yashica JP, Yashica FX3, Leica M, Leica R, Diana F, Diana F mini,  Raspberry Pi are a trademarks. Risks and challengesDelivery times may differ significantly due to the production lead times, nevertheless, like I did in my past campaigns, I'm improving the entire supply chain process which is much leaner now. The PCB and the sensors may differ from the one showed at the pictures above, nevertheless the resolution and quality will be necessarily equal or higher.",82.0,5,"4 Campaigns

column1: • With YouCan BW1’s 4K camera you can film in 30FPS for smooth quality capture, Explore the vibrant underwater world behind the screen and control your destination with the attachable controller for your tablet and smartphone, or just use your touch-screen device with the YouCan app.
• The camera can rotate +45° to capture anything below or above the ROV drone.

• YouCan BW1's maximum 150-meter tether (selected perks) allows you to dive deep down to 100 meters and explore the deep ocean floor with ease. With the 3 propellers (2 vertical, 1 horizontal) and 3 Knots speed, it is easy to navigate the seabed and control it away from the current.
• When you come across a moment you want to capture, you can lock BW-1 into position and with its self-stabilization, BW-1 will balance itself in the current.
• BW-1’s Wi-Fi repeater makes it easy to stay connected. With its 200m range, the repeater connects the drone to your device enabling you to stream the footage directly to your smart device.

• The 2 LED lights can illuminate the ocean bed to give you your optimal viewing and can self-adjust to its surroundings. You can also attach LED light racks to BW-1 to provide more light in less visible areas.
• The powerful battery makes record time last 3-5 hours of normal usage. Light usage has a battery life of 5-7 hours.

YouCan Robot was established in 2015. Dedicated to being the worlds best underwater robotic products and underwater photography. Our vision is to provide an endless exploration of the deep unknown.
column55:
> 

Q. What is the battery life? Hours of continuous use? How does YouCan BW1 charge?

A. The battery can last between 5-7 hours with minimal use. For more of a continuous use, the battery can last 3-5 hours. The total charge time is 8-9 hours

Q. What are the dimensions and weight?

A. 40cm × 24cm × 12cm/4.6KG

Q. How do I turn it on and off?

A. You turn on the drone through the YouCan app.

Q. How do you set it up?

A. Connect the drone and the wifi repeater with the tether, open the YouCan app and connect to the drone. Once connected YouCan BW1 is ready to go! 

Q. Does it have an app? Which phones does it work with?

A. Yes, the app is available for iPhone/Android phone/iPad/Android pad and is available from the App Store &
column56:
Google Play.

Q. How do you maintain the drone &
column57:
clean it?

A. Soak the drone in distilled water for 24 hours after it has been used.

Q. What is your refund policy?

A. We only refund before the item has been delivered. When the item has been delivered, no refunds are available 

Q. Does this product come with a warranty?

A. Yes, 6 months of non-human damage, you can send to the designated repair point. Any more than 6 months there will be a charge for spare parts.

Q. Do I have to pay VAT/GST?

A. Yes

If you require our press kit you can get it here - https://goo.gl/vjGGLx

column1: YouCan BW 1 has had a major upgrade. With its new 4K video camera & 12mp image camera, capturing the vivid underwater world from dry land has never been easier - especially with BW1 incredible Indiegogo price, there has never been a better time to explore unknown territories!
BW1 APP User Guide:YoucanDive has been released to Apple Store

YouCan BlueWater 1 (YouCan BW1) is the powerful & affordable underwater ROV drone that lets you capture your new underwater adventure while you wait on dry land. Perfect for beginners with its easy to use controls, who want to test the waters and explore a new world or advanced adventurers who love to explore & see more of the world they already know & love. We want you to experience your own underwater adventure that you can control with a powerful yet affordable underwater ROV drone. We want you to explore the ocean depths and learn the wonders of the world we don’t see. What is an ROV you ask? Remotely Operated Vehicle. You man the wheel of your own adventure and explore what lies beneath. With its new 4K video capture, you can experience an underwater world in HD & capture vivid images with the 12MP camera. With a Maximum depth of 100 Meters and 3-5 Hours of battery life, YouCan BW1 is designed to meet the needs of longtime underwater exploration whether you are a beginner or expert.

With YouCan BW1’s 4K camera you can film in 30FPS for smooth quality capture, Explore the vibrant underwater world behind the screen and control your destination with the attachable controller for your tablet and smartphone, or just use your touch-screen device with the YouCan app.
The camera can rotate +45° to capture anything below or above the ROV drone.

YouCan BW1's maximum 150-meter tether (selected perks) allows you to dive deep down to 100 meters and explore the deep ocean floor with ease. With the 3 propellers (2 vertical, 1 horizontal) and 3 Knots speed, it is easy to navigate the seabed and control it away from the current.
When you come across a moment you want to capture, you can lock BW-1 into position and with its self-stabilization, BW-1 will balance itself in the current.
BW-1’s Wi-Fi repeater makes it easy to stay connected. With its 200m range, the repeater connects the drone to your device enabling you to stream the footage directly to your smart device.

The 2 LED lights can illuminate the ocean bed to give you your optimal viewing and can self-adjust to its surroundings. You can also attach LED light racks to BW-1 to provide more light in less visible areas.
The powerful battery makes record time last 3-5 hours of normal usage. Light usage has a battery life of 5-7 hours.

BW1 Self-stabilization keeping the drone balanced and level in the current  YouCan BW1's controller makes your underwater exploration easy and fun to use for anyone! Advanced users or beginners.  YouCan BW1 App The YouCan app allows you to control the drone with your touchscreen device. In the app, you can control the drones speed & the light intensity.    YouCan BW1 Depth Test Under our engineer's instructions ,BW 1  moves forward and backward freely in the water, 2 LED lights can provide sufficient illumination under  the water. The deepest place can reach 100 meters.   You can download our Tech Spec sheet here - https://goo.gl/jDPLs6   Production        How BW1 Works The tether connects to the drone and the wifi extender with the YouCan app. The drone transfers and live streams the images and videos to the wifi extender through the cable

column1: A different photo is added every other day. There are 21 photos spread over 42 days. A 22nd photo, a magnolia blossom, is a special only available as part of the full run. All are shown in the top image with those remaining faded out. The camera in the center is the desired result of this campaign.
The next photo will be put up at the end of the day on Tuesday, October 7.

All of these photos were taken by myself with a Kyocera Torque cellphone camera. They were selected from many taken over the past year as the best for display and printing. A cellphone camera is not ideal for consistent, fine-detail work.

My love of nature and eye for what would make a good photo are matched by a desire to share this knowledge and beauty with the world. A photo blog would be a good outlet. Many people have encouraged me to publish one as I kept showing them flower photos and telling them all about the plants.

I am a Certified Horticulturist, through the American Society for Horticultural Science, and was a professional gardener for three years. My career has recently progressed into the trees and I am now an arborist, a tree guy. I dig in the dirt and reach for the tree tops.

A cellphone camera is not an ideal solution for consistent quality and fine detail photography. This campaign's success will allow me to purchase a high-level camera capable of creating a portfolio to be published to a photo blog and printed out in large-scale format, such as wall-hanging canvas, to be sold in an accompanying online store. The proceeds of the store would go towards my return to college in order to further continue along my career path.
The camera I have chosen is the Nikon 1 AW1, which retails for $750 for a kit that includes 1 lens. This model was chosen for its waterproof &
column2: shockproof ruggedness while still delivering reasonable fine detail and high quality results.

column1: If the campaign does not succeed in reaching the goal, all funds remaining after transaction fees and perks will be put into the savings account for eventual purchase of the camera.

Stretch Goals

The stated campaign goal is an initial milestone along an extensive path. As the title states, the milestones stretch from camera to college.

column2: a couple lenses to further increase the fine detail &amp

column1: $5,000 : I am qualified to take the Certified Arborist exam through the International Society of Arboriculture and currently studying for it. These study materials are Continuing Education Units (CEUs) to reach the qualification necessary to take the Board Certified Master Arborist exam.

~$10,000 : A photo set that I have in mind is a matched set of photos taken at exactly opposite points of the globe. One of the sets this is possible at, and be land-based at both places, is Christchurch Botanical Garden in New Zealand and the northern tip of Spain near A Coruña.
Scaled back, the travel would be to various botanical gardens nationally and regions with distinct plants.
$$$$$ : Higher education is expensive. I currently have an Associate's of Applied Science degree in Horticulture.

The perks for this campaign are thank you postcards bearing today's photo. The photo showing at the top will be the postcard you receive in the mail. The photo is changed every other day. The full run consists of 21 different photos.There is a special bonus postcard in addition to the regulars.

My wife's favorite photo is this extreme close-up of a magnolia blossom. The photograph was capable of being blown up and printed to a canvas that is now hanging on the wall. I presented it to her for a demiversary (6 month) present.
This postcard is only available to those who choose the Full Run perk.

column2: numbered in order of payment postcards are an available option.

column2:
>You don't make a photograph just with a camera. You bring to the act of photography all the pictures you have seen, the books you have read, the music you have heard, the people you have loved.
― Ansel Adams

column4: >Since my first class in analog (darkroom) photography in high school, I've loved photography.  At the North Carolina School of Science I was lucky to live on a campus with almost 24 access to a darkroom and an awesome mentor (shout-out to Joe Liles!).
column7: >Since then, through art classes at Brown University, photojournalism courses at PUC-Rio in Brazil, and documenting my travels through Latin America, my love of photography has only grown.

column2: is about more than creativity.  It's about a way of looking at the universe, of noticing, of paying attention. Taking photos is an adventure into the world and it's wonders, and an adventure into my own perspective, my own soul.

column1: I've spent a lot of time learning about photography, but have honestly always been a little intimidated to pursue it with greater professional and artistic commitment. This year I set some goals for myself. To make bold decisions and to follow through whether I feel ready or not. After all, if you wait till you feel ready, you might never do it at all.
So, ready or not, I'm diving in!

I'm currently working on putting up a photography exhibition at Early Girl Eatery in downtown, Asheville. It's an excellent opportunity for me to display art that I have worked very hard on over the last few years and that I care deeply about. It's a great way to open doors, and a jumping off point for committing myself wholeheartedly to doing more work with photography in the near future.

Where does your money go?

Photography is an incredibly awesome, but expensive art. Printing, framing and hanging my photography for the exhibit alone costs nearly $500.  So your money goes directly into the cost of putting up the exhibit.

I've chosen indiegogo's flexible funding option, meaning that even if I don't meet my fundraising goal of $500, I'll still receive whatever has been raised when the deadline roles around.  The reason I've chose this option is because I took a leap of faith a few weeks ago and I am already working on this exhibit! It goes up on August 11th.  I've already made the commitment. I used my money that was supposed to be for bills and hacked into my meager savings to make this happen, trusting that the universe supports whole-hearted efforts.
Now I need your help to aid me in landing on solid ground after that leap of faith!

Since indiegogo takes out a percentage of what I fundraise, the first place any extra money will go to will be to paying the site. After that, the first chunk of cash will go towards putting your perk packages together.

If I manage to raise enough money to pay for the exhibit to go up, cover indiegogo's fees and to pay for the cost of creating and sending your perks,  than any additional money will go towards furthering my creative work in photography in a variety of ways. Some possibilities include:
- Taking an advanced digital photography course to hone skills and continue building a knowledge base of how to use technology in the realm of photography.
- Acquiring a new computer that can handle storing and editing high quality images.

- Acquiring a lens (or two) that are better than my kit lens that came with my camera.  Because, as most photographers know, the quality of your lens affects your image way more than the body of your camera. Extra cash will definitely go towards funding photography equipment and supplies.
-Funding both big and small photography adventures where I can continue to build my portfolio, grow my body of work, and develop my skills.

column2: >Are you as excited about this endeavor as I am but don't have any cash to spare at the moment? That's ok! You can also help me by promoting my fundraising efforts and sharing this page with your social networks! And you can come see my exhibit at Early Girl Eatery in downtown Asheville over the next 3 months.

column1: ","You don't make a photograph just with a camera. You bring to the act of photography all the pictures you have seen, the books you have read, the music you have heard, the people you have loved.― Ansel Adams

Since my first class in analog (darkroom) photography in high school, I've loved photography.  At the North Carolina School of Science I was lucky to live on a campus with almost 24 access to a darkroom and an awesome mentor (shout-out to Joe Liles!).  Since then, through art classes at Brown University, photojournalism courses at PUC-Rio in Brazil, and documenting my travels through Latin America, my love of photography has only grown.
To me, photography goes beyond technicality
column2: is about more than creativity.  It's about a way of looking at the universe, of noticing, of paying attention. Taking photos is an adventure into the world and it's wonders, and an adventure into my own perspective, my own soul.

column2: >Currently Beacon Hill Arts does not own its own filmmaking equipment. We have to borrow from friendly individuals and production companies. By helping us to buy a camera you can help us to ensure that our young filmmakers can have the equipment they need to keep on making their brilliant films!

column1: VIDDY is a screenprinted do-it-yourself pinhole camera kit made from tough, durable recycled card. It accepts both medium format and 35mm film.
Each and every VIDDY is screenprinted and die-cut by hand in the UK and is available in 4 colours
VIDDY comes as a kit and the main pieces you'll need simply pop out so you'll go from flat pack to working camera in around half an hour!
Stickers and split pins are used to build the main body and you just need a small drop of glue to construct the film advance knobs.
There's no sharps, virtually no glue, and no mess.

Each VIDDY kit comes with everything you'll need to complete the camera, including a reclaimed medium format spool, a precision laser-cut pinhole, a red light-proof window, split pins, a sticker sheet and clear illustrated online instructions alongside an easy to follow how-to video.
It's simple, educational, fully functional and takes great photographs. But most importantly, it's fun!

column2: >Each VIDDY kit also comes with two decorative front sticker panels designed exclusively for this Kickstarter campaign by illustrators
column6: >. You'll receive both designs with your VIDDY kit. Check them out!

column1: A pinhole camera is a simple camera that uses a single small aperture - a pinhole - instead of a lens.

As light passes through this hole, an image is exposed onto the film loaded inside the camera. Exposure times are typically longer than with a normal lensed camera, due to the aperture being so much smaller. This means that pinhole cameras can typically take anywhere from a few seconds to a couple of hours to expose a photograph. Because of these long exposures the shutter is usually manually operated.
It strips complex photographic concepts down to their basic foundation: Light. How much to let in, and for how long!
The VIDDY is the little sibling of our VIDERE pinhole camera.
(To read more about our first camera, VIDERE, check out our website.)
It's been in development for the past 6 months and is a direct result of the feedback we've received from the fantastic community of current Pop-Up Pinhole users.

column6:
schema=vimeo"" width=""580"">

This is our development method. It’s simple, but it works.

column1: We are always listening and making improvements to our designs. VIDDY is ever evolving and we'd love you to join the journey.

VIDDY is easy to use, easy to load and has lots of new user experience features to make it our best model yet. These include a film viewing window, shutter indicator and virtually glue-free construction.

It's also the best kit yet for little hands and we've been successfully testing it in schools with children as young as 11 as part of educational workshops. Constructing a camera by hand that can take real photographs, using the simplest method possible, transforms complex concepts into hands-on understanding.
So far the VIDDY has been used to teach subjects as wide-ranging as science, maths, history, art and design and engineering.
When you support this project you'll not only be helping get the VIDDY get into production, but you'll also be be helping its development as an educational aid for use in schools and colleges.

column2: >We could have just sent our VIDDY prototypes out to journalists and bloggers, but instead we decided to run a user testing programme and get the kits into the hands of the people that really matter: you!

column1: We used what funds we had to make 80 VIDDY prototype kits, and we've been running testing sessions and workshops across the country and sending kits out for testing around the globe. They've been tried out everywhere from the south of Australia to San Francisco and our testers have varied from school kids to pro-baristas. We've also made sure we've tested them on everyone from pinhole fanatics to film photography virgins- we like to cover all bases!
If there's one thing we're certain of, it's that VIDDY definitely isn't just for photography buffs.
Check out London based photographer Lydia Garnett testing out one of our early VIDDY prototype models >
Since The Pop-Up Pinhole Company was founded we've always only used local suppliers that are small, independent, and place an emphasis on craft and quality.

The craftspeople we work with have been honing their skills for several decades, which means you get one of the highest quality products possible and you can be assured in the knowledge that you are helping to support independent British businesses.
Each VIDDY kit will come with a basic exposure guide as part of the instructions- but we know that you’re not going to have that with you every time you are out having fun shooting with your VIDDY.

The Pop-Up Pinhole app is our solution. You just need to fire it up, select your film speed and conditions, and you'll be shown exactly how long to keep the shutter open on your VIDDY for perfectly exposed pictures.
Delivery to USA and Rest of World: 10-15 working days.
Last order date for Christmas for the UK (standard delivery) - 18th December.
Last order date for Christmas for the UK (Next Day delivery) - 23rd December.
Last order date for Christmas - Asia, Far East (inc. Japan), New Zealand - 3rd December.
Last order date for Christmas - Australia - 4th December.
Last order date for Christmas - Cyprus, Eastern Europe, Greece - 8th December.
Last order date for Christmas - USA - 12th December.
Last order date for Christmas - Western Europe (exclusing Greece, Poland) - 13th December.
","VIDDY is a screenprinted do-it-yourself pinhole camera kit made from tough, durable recycled card. It accepts both medium format and 35mm film.
Each and every VIDDY is screenprinted and die-cut by hand in the UK and is available in 4 colours
VIDDY comes as a kit and the main pieces you'll need simply pop out so you'll go from flat pack to working camera in around half an hour!
Stickers and split pins are used to build the main body and you just need a small drop of glue to construct the film advance knobs.
There's no sharps, virtually no glue, and no mess.

Each VIDDY kit comes with everything you'll need to complete the camera, including a reclaimed medium format spool, a precision laser-cut pinhole, a red light-proof window, split pins, a sticker sheet and clear illustrated online instructions alongside an easy to follow how-to video.
It's simple, educational, fully functional and takes great photographs. But most importantly, it's fun!

Each VIDDY kit also comes with two decorative front sticker panels designed exclusively for this Kickstarter campaign by illustrators Becca Allen and Suzi Kemp. You'll receive both designs with your VIDDY kit. Check them out!

The Sling is a brand new, re-engineered camera strap from Restrap which gives photographers the power to switch cameras in seconds, shoot comfortably all day and keep their lens cap at touching distance at all times.
The Grip Sling accompanies the Sling, keeping the camera firmly and comfortably attached to the hand for instant shooting.
The revolutionary Cap Clip attaches to your Sling, belt or bag to keep your lens cap firmly in reach at all times.
These are “SNAPS”, dual 20mm magnetic connectors that make a solid link between your camera and the Sling.
Attach one to your camera and it will seamlessly connect to the Sling straps for effortless photography.
No more tugging straps or pulling buckles. The SNAPS allow you to attach, adjust, detach and change cameras in a matter of seconds. Photography on the go has never been easier.
Our full range also includes our unique magnetic cap system. Attach our magnetic connector using the adhesive backing to the lens cap and shoot away.
The Sling: an ergonomically designed shoulder strap that holds your camera in place across the shoulder or neck. Fully padded and adjustable for all sizes.
The Sling is available with the option of three padding colours: black, orange and grey.

It's little brother the Grip attaches to the hand, allowing you to keep your camera close for those unforeseen photo opportunities. Like the Sling, we’ve got your comfort in mind, with padding and easy adjustment.
Both versions contain magnetic quick release buckles so you can easily change between cameras.
Best of all, our straps are hand-made in Yorkshire, UK by a dedicated team who love photography as much as you do.

We know that your camera is precious. That’s why we’ve worked hard to produce a strap that can withstand the harshest of shooting conditions. We have vigorously tested both the Sling and Grip Sling so you can be confident in their strength and durability.
All magnets used in the Sling have a break force of 100kg, ensuring your camera will remain fully attached at all times. It’s not going anywhere.
Nor are your photos – all our magnets are 100% memory-card safe, meaning no interference with your digital images..
Both the Sling and Grip Sling are made from high quality, performance materials:
Double layered, lightweight and breathable neoprene padding which fits the shoulder and neck perfectly. Available in black, orange and grey.
Super strong, lazercut Hypalon™ structure, famed for its resistance to extreme weather conditions.
Over-engineered SD card safe magnetic connectors which allow the strap to be changed between cameras in seconds.
Both straps are finished to the highest quality, with detailed laser cut designs for stylish shooting.

We are Restrap, a British, family-run business specialising in hand-made outdoor accessories. We started life in a back bedroom in 2010. From a single sewing machine, founder Nathan began making accessories for the outdoor market, initially pedal straps for bicycles, and then bags and holsters. The back bedroom quickly became too small. Six years on and Restrap is now based in a large workshop on the outskirts of Leeds. We’re a close-knit team of outdoor enthusiasts, who design, develop and sew all our products by hand. We’re really proud of our Yorkshire roots and the landscape that’s inspired our products.

My photography started out as a hobby after my head injury, I slowly started to build up my talent without any schooling. Family and friends keep telling me I have an eye for what I'm doing. I saved up enough to buy myself a Nikon d7100 camera and my skills greatly improved, until today while shooting my camera tripod fell over causing my camera to be submerge in a foot of salt water. So due to the salt water my camera and wide angle lens no longer works. I'm on a disability pension so chances of me saving up enough money to get new equipment wont happen. The reason I'm starting this is that the photography gave me a great feeling of accomplishment being able to get out of my house and capture Mother natures Beauty through my camera lens.  To me this was never a money making thing it was more about the praise I got from the people that liked and commented on my photos  on FB  IG and Flickr. It helped me feel better about myself after my injury when people I know and even don't know praised my work ...I'm including a link to my best work so that people can see the talent I have....https://www.flickr.com/photos/elcid2011/
