It was a scheduled shoot for a local DJ so to give him a special shoot, I went ahead and hired a 5D Mark III. Location had already been finalised, but parking was the issue. Eventually we found one a walking distance away from the loaction. I had two backpacks with me one belonging to myself and the other rental store.

As we got of the car, I decided to leave the backpack with my personal camera and hired accessories. It was merely a very quick decision which changed everything. The only things I took with me were the 5D from the store and my laptop as I did not need two cameras, let alone two backpacks.

When we returned from the shoot, I happened to notice some shattered glass near the car. As we approached, the car had been broken into and everything that was in it gone.

And thats how I lost our gear which took us almost 4yrs to save up for :(

“Our mission is to raise support for a photography show that
will put the camera in the hands of middle school students, not just to teach
but to see through their eyes how the Benson neighborhood is growing.”
The Benson neighborhood and downtown areas are growing in
amazing ways. New shops and businesses are going in drumming up traffic from
all over the Omaha metroplex. These changes deserve to be documented and our
goal is to do it through pictures.
These pictures won’t be taken by adults but by middle school
students in the Benson area who have lived in the neighborhood for years and
have experienced this growth. They will participate in an afternoon of learning
a bit about the cameras they’ll be using.
We only need one thing to make this happen and that’s your
support! With your help we will provide these kids with the equipment for not
just a photography show but equipment that they can use through out their time
in middle and high school. They’ll be able to use these cameras for years to
help them learn and explore the art of photography.
The money that we raise will go towards the purchase of the
transportation for the kids to and from the 402 Arts Collective in Benson, and
the necessary supplies for the photography show.

100 Cameras

We are collaborating with 100 Cameras because we share the same goals. Starting in 2009, 100 Cameras purpose is to teach kids the art of photography and to share their fresh perspective on the community surrounding them. 

100 Cameras started in 2008 with their first project in South Sudan. They gave cameras to kids in an orphanage there with the hope that the kids would be able to tell stories that adults or outside photographers could not. What they saw in return was amazing. ""In a hard place that most would call hopeless, these images told a different story: one full of life, hope, and joy."" 

Since then, 100 Cameras have completed four other projects in locations like New York City, Cuba, India, and Baltimore, while giving the are of photography to 46 kids. The stories that have been told from around the world continue to change their community, all through the eyes of kids and their cameras. 

Giving

We realize that without you, this show won’t happen. That’s

why we are excited to offer a few things in return. Check out the list of goodies to the right.

Please know that even $5 adds up and will give these kids the chance of a lifetime. If you aren't able to give monetarily please help by telling your friends, family, coworker in the cubical next to you, and anyone else you run into through out the day about this project we would appreciate it!

Follow updates at #thebensonlens

Follow The 402 on Twitter and Facebook
Follow 100 Cameras on Twitter and Facebook

Diego Delso is known as Poco a poco in Wikipedia and Wikimedia Commons. In case you don't know, Wikimedia Commons is a media file repository where anyone can share freely-licensed content with everyone. Wikipedia (the free encyclopedia you use every day), and every other Wikimedia project, uses Wikimedia Commons as its image repository, so, in fact, most of the times you view (or download) an image in Wikipedia, you are actually viewing a Wikimedia Commons image.

column1:
As Wikimedia volunteers and Diego's friends, we could not stand aside of this, so we decided to help him to restore his equipment. You can help, too, by contributing to this campaign!

Our goal is simple: to collect enough money to help Diego to buy exactly the same equipment he lost.

column10:
>

Diego Delso es conocido como Poco a poco en Wikipedia y Wikimedia Commons. Por si no lo sabes, Wikimedia Commons es un repositorio multimedia donde cualquier persona puede compartir contenido con licencia libre con todos. Wikipedia (la enciclopedia libre que usas todos los días), al igual que todos los demás proyectos Wikimedia, usa Wikimedia Commons como su repositorio de imágenes, así que, de hecho, la mayoría de veces que ves (o descargas) una imagen de Wikipedia, realmente estás viendo una imagen de Wikimedia Commons.

column1: A pesar de que Diego es sólo uno de los miles de voluntarios de Wikimedia Commons, es uno muy especial: es uno de los principales contribuyentes a Wikimedia Commons en toda su historia, teniendo algunos récords impresionantes, como ser el usuario con la mayor cantidad de Imágenes Destacadas (153 imágenes) y, al mismo tiempo, la mayor cantidad de Imágenes de Calidad (5,777 imágenes). Es una cantidad sorprendente de material de muy alta calidad, que Diego ha donado a todas las personas del mundo.

Para ir más allá, Diego ha contribuido en Wikimedia Commons de otros modos. Uno de ellos es mediante el apoyo (siendo organizador o jurado) a dos de los concursos fotográficos más importantes del movimiento Wikimedia (¡y del mundo!): Wiki Loves Monuments y Wiki Loves Earth.

Lastimosamente, mientras que Diego estaba en Buenos Aires tras participar de un encuentro Iberoamericano de Wikimedistas, personas inescrupulosas robaron su equipo fotográfico. En este evento desafortunado, Diego no sólo perdió su cámara, lentes y computador portátil, sino también todas las fotografías que había tomado durante su viaje de 2 semanas por Sudamérica, que iba a subir a Wikimedia Commons para que pudieran ser usadas por cualquier persona, en cualquier lugar.

Como voluntarios del movimiento Wikimedia y amigos de Diego, no podríamos quedarnos sin hacer nada, así que decidimos ayudarlo a restablecer su equipo. ¡Tú también puedes ayudar contribuyendo a esta campaña!
Nuestra meta es simple: reunir suficiente dinero para ayudar a Diego a comprar de nuevo el equipo que perdió.

Diego Delso is known as Poco a poco in Wikipedia and Wikimedia Commons. In case you don't know, Wikimedia Commons is a media file repository where anyone can share freely-licensed content with everyone. Wikipedia (the free encyclopedia you use every day), and every other Wikimedia project, uses Wikimedia Commons as its image repository, so, in fact, most of the times you view (or download) an image in Wikipedia, you are actually viewing a Wikimedia Commons image.

While Diego is just one of the thousands of Wikimedia Commons volunteers, he is a very special one: he's one of the main Wikimedia Commons contributors ever, having some amazing records, such as being the user with the highest amount of Featured Pictures (153 images) and quality images (5,777 images). That's an awesome amount of very high quality material, that Diego has given to every living person for free.

Furthermore, Diego has contributed in Wikimedia Commons in other ways. One of them is by supporting (by being an organizer or a jury) two of the most important photographic contests in the Wikimedia movement (and in the world!): Wiki Loves Monuments and Wiki Loves Earth.

Sadly, while Diego was in Buenos Aires after participating in a Wikimedia Iberoamerican meeting with other Wikimedia volunteers, he got his equipment stolen. In this unfortunate event, he didn't only lost his camera, zoom lenses and laptop, but also every single picture he took during his 2 weeks trip in South America, which he was going to upload to Wikimedia Commons so they could be used by everyone, everywhere.

As Wikimedia volunteers and Diego's friends, we could not stand aside of this, so we decided to help him to restore his equipment. You can help, too, by contributing to this campaign!Our goal is simple: to collect enough money to help Diego to buy exactly the same equipment he lost.
The gear he lost in Argentina is described below, with a reference to the price from Amazon for the same equipment.
Converted to Euro (since Diego is based in Europe) that goes to 5,300 Euro + 300 euro of Indiegogo fee, which is our target to collect.

Es una cantidad sorprendente de material de muy alta calidad, que Diego ha donado a todas las personas del mundo.

Para ir más allá, Diego ha contribuido en Wikimedia Commons de otros modos. Uno de ellos es mediante el apoyo (siendo organizador o jurado) a dos de los concursos fotográficos más importantes del movimiento Wikimedia (¡y del mundo!): Wiki Loves Monuments y Wiki Loves Earth.

Lastimosamente, mientras que Diego estaba en Buenos Aires tras participar de un encuentro Iberoamericano de Wikimedistas, personas inescrupulosas robaron su equipo fotográfico. En este evento desafortunado, Diego no sólo perdió su cámara, lentes y computador portátil, sino también todas las fotografías que había tomado durante su viaje de 2 semanas por Sudamérica, que iba a subir a Wikimedia Commons para que pudieran ser usadas por cualquier persona, en cualquier lugar.

Como voluntarios del movimiento Wikimedia y amigos de Diego, no podríamos quedarnos sin hacer nada, así que decidimos ayudarlo a restablecer su equipo. ¡Tú también puedes ayudar contribuyendo a esta campaña!
Nuestra meta es simple: reunir suficiente dinero para ayudar a Diego a comprar de nuevo el equipo que perdió.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"

Latest Status: 28 Orders Shipped

 

Official Accessories

About Us

Kalacam is a high-tech brand in Shenzhen. It is an independent brand focusing on action cameras and accessories.

With the concept and start point of ‘innovation, quality and service’, we brings high-quality and Innovative products for outdoor sports lovers. Kalacam is deeply loved and sought after by both domestic and foreign customer. We are striving to be the best brand of action cameras.

Why Crowdfunding

Life is so wonderful. It deserve us to record, but the traditional camera always leave us a memory full of partial plane photography, it’s fragmented record.

How to keep a complete record of the journey with joys and sorrows.

How to present the splendor of the world.

Innovate the current situation of the imaging industry.

Break the shackles of the hardware material to make funny and playful black technology.

Make records out of the 2-dimensional bound to let everyone get a complete journey without regret.

After 2 years hard work of research and development, trial production, modification, technology improvement, we finally honed this elaborate work.

We hope that by the crowd funding to let more people use our product to enjoy the fun of life, and experience a more exciting way of living.

Let technology bring more novelty and play to our life!

Gopro is the original and the best action camera in the world.

But even they still have some shortcomings:

1. Ordinary action camera are not as shock resistant.

Hundreds of thousand action cameras broke every year.

A customer needs several accessories to protect their action camera. A shock-resistant action camera should be par for the course.

2. Ordinary action camera are not waterproof.

As outdoor sport related to water, like surfing, swimming, rafting, snorkeling, divng etc. Currently most of the action camera needs a extra waterproof housing to be used in the water. We think action cameras should be waterproof without the housing. 

3. Ordinary action camera do not float but sink down in water.

Many action cameras are lost every year by sinking to the bottom of the ocean, lake, etc. We set out to create a camera that can float on the water, so that you never have to worry about losing your camera and your memories with out product. 

With these three pain points, the Kalacam R&
column2:
D team has been working hard to find a solutions and believe we’ve designed a action camera that will help the users solve the above problems.

In June 2016, we began a new challenge, a new journey, and we began working hard to design this product.

After two years later, the Kalacam R&
column3:
D team has continuously improved over 100 times and conducted more than 1,000 experiments and tests. Our new product finally came out.

column3:
>

A picture speaks a thousand words. An amazing photo conveys emotions. Taking a great photo of something we feel passionate about gives us – and our audience – an incredible feeling. Whether it's a magnificent mountain, the glorious sunset, an architectural wonder, our favorite person / animal, etc., we all have something that we love to photograph.

We’ve been reaching increasingly for our phones to capture memories. It’s simply easier, more accessible, and less bulky. However, we all know how it feels when a blurry photograph is all that remains of a perfect moment.

Words can’t explain everything. We want to give our mobile photos the chance to reach into our hearts, to go beyond “beautiful”, “gorgeous”, and “amazing”. That means giving more people the ability to capture images beyond the current limits of mobile photography. This is why we set out to create OOWA, the highest-quality mobile photography lenses in the market.
column5:
>

OOWA lenses are unlike any other. Our patented free-form technology is uniquely optimized for translating the image circle onto the iPhone's rectangular sensor. This results in superior edge-to-edge image quality with no dark corners and no color bleeding. Mobile photography will never be the same again.

We are thrilled to finally launch our first set of lenses - a 15mm wide-angle lens, and a 2.5X zoom lens for the iPhone 6 series. Join the mobile photography revolution. Pre-order your OOWA lenses on Indiegogo now!

 (Not an iPhone 6, 6+, 6S or 6S+ user? Click
column6: w=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">here to help us select our next phone model.)
column11: >Click here for an in-depth review of our lenses by Mashable.
column20:
>15mm Wide-Angle Lens

Bring the out of range into reach. Perfect for that mountaintop shot, a table-full of delicious delights, and a full-screen shot of our puppy’s nose.
column23:
>2.5X Telephoto

Get intimate from afar. Get up-close with your favorite band, sneak a photo of the cute skateboarder across the street, or make someone’s smile the highlight of the day.
column28: > Here are some beautiful images taken with OOWA lenses.
column34:
>

Our lenses come with a complementary case. We looked towards pro-cameras for inspiration in our design. Equipped with bayonet mounts, the lenses are attached to the case with a simple twist.
column40:
>In The Lab

We have entire walls and ceilings in our lab and office covered in dots. Literally like this.
column41:
>

We take photographs of these dots with various products, carefully cut up the image and then examine the image quality of every single dot, at every single position. Compared to the leading competitor OOWA especially at the edges, performs better on measures of image sharpness (Spatial Frequency Response / SFR) and color bleeding (lateral chromatic aberration).
column43:
>In The Field

The image below was taken with the OOWA 2.5x telephoto lens. The area circled in red is shown close-up to review in greater detail. Notice how the white base of the pavilion has a straight color edge against the black shadows.
column44:
>

 

The image below was taken with a leading brand's 2x telephoto lens, standing in the same spot. The area circled in red is shown close-up to review in greater detail. Notice how the white base bleeds blue vertically into the black shadows below, and bleeds yellow on the left.
column45:
>

 Read more about our image quality in Martyn William's review for PC World.
column48:
>What are free-form lenses? 

The differentiating feature of a free-form lens is that it is rotationally asymmetrical. Traditional cameras use rotationally symmetrical optics, but the phone cameras are much smaller. Simply scaling down traditional optics produces limited results.
column49:
>Why free-form?

The unique shape of a free-form lens enables it to translate an image more precisely onto the phone's small rectangular sensor, resulting in a higher level of image quality throughout.
column51: >
column53:
>

 

We are serious about taking mobile photography beyond its limits. Our product pushes the boundaries of conventional mobile imaging systems by achieving specifications not typically found in lens attachments.
column56:
>

 

We’ve spent many months refining our prototypes, and worked closely with our lens manufacturer to ensure that we are able to achieve mass production. We are confident of delivering our lenses from November onwards into early December (hint: they’ll make great Christmas gifts!). Here’s our production schedule:

Mass production is a costly process in part because of the necessary investments in moulds and in tooling, but also due to our desire to place larger orders so that we can secure lower prices (and transfer these savings to you)! You can help us keep our prices low by making a pre-order.
column58:
>

 

OOWA was designed and conceptualised by a team of industry and domain experts with extensive experience in optical design and engineering.

To learn more about the talented individuals behind OOWA, please visit our website.
column61: >
column64:
>

 

Thanks for reading to the end, and being with us!

We've come a long way, and we wouldn't have made it this far without the support of our backers. So here's thank you to each and every one of you!

Also, a big thank you to our family, friends, and everyone who believes in us. Your love, feedback, and encouragement continues to make this journey possible.  

To the creative eyes who have guided us through this process: Sativa Turner, Tyler Cooper (@whereistyco). We are forever grateful for your good taste! 

To our interns: Sofia Samuelsson, Qiu Fanyuan, Loh Ying Hui. We love you and couldn't have done it without you. OOWA! 

To the photographers in the world who have shared their passion with us, and given us invaluable product feedback: Tara Van Leerdam (@taravanleerdam), Mark Hirsch (@blockhouseroller_markhirsch), Dewitt Jones, Leonard Lee, Darren Soh, Tan Sock Cheng (@taniasc), Meredith Narrowe

Cameras: Jim Granato at Autonomy16 Productions

Logo Design:  Andrew Cloutier

Product Lifestyle shots: Claudia Goetzelmann 

Friends we just owe: Chan Yiu Lin, Chris at Humangear, Marcus Scharnowsky, Alexa Lee, Tim Young

Partners in crime you might expect to hear more from: StartX founders Borui Wang at Polarr (essential tools for pros to edit pictures on the go, no matter if you’re on web, desktop, or mobile) and Tom Zimberoff at Pixterity.

In its nearly 45-year history, Visual Communications has played a key role in the development of Asian Pacific American cinema. We were the first APA filmmaker’s organization, founded in 1970, and we produced among the first films to articulate the experiences of APAs. And we have played a key role in training and promoting the next generation of APA filmmakers through initiatives as Project Catalyst, the Conference for Creative Content (C3) and The Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival.

But there is one thing we haven’t done... until NOW. And YOU can help us make it a rousing success.

JOIN US as Visual Communications launches its first-ever crowdsourcing campaign to support the Armed With a Camera Fellowship for Emerging Media Artists (AWC)!
With a Camera Fellowship for Emerging Media Artists has nurtured a new
generation of Asian Pacific Americans to articulate their experiences and
perspectives through the powerful medium of film. Along the way, we’ve seen AWC
productions inspire newer generations of artists to pick up a motion picture
camera and make their own movies, and additionally be showcased at festivals,
community screenings, and online venues all over the world:
fellowship cycles, yielding a crop of nearly 100 digital films.
with Ernesto Foronda (AWC '02), nearly one out of
every five AWC Fellows has gone on to direct and/or produce a feature-length
productions been showcased at our LA Asian Pacific Film Festival, but also at other film festivals in San Francisco, San Diego,
New York City, Boston, Chicago, Washington DC, and have even been showcased at

international venues as the Cinemanila International Film Festival in Manila.  This year's Fellows even saw one of their AWC films be a finalist for the Student Academy Awards (Rahat Mahajan's RESIGNATION).
finally, AWC productions have promoted the economic and resourceful ethos of
the Fellowship, and have encouraged “outside-the-box” thinking in how Fellows
Now, on the cusp of the Fellowship’s Lucky 13th season, we’re appealing
to YOU to insure that this ground-breaking community institution continues to
inspire and equip tomorrow’s filmmaking masters.
Because of the shifting landscape of corporate and foundation grants, funding for the Fellowship has declined.  In most cases, developments like this can be devastating to arts
organizations, like Visual Communications, that operate its programs on a
shoestring budget. Other groups, when faced with challenges brought on by
de-funding or budget cuts, choose to suspend or fold otherwise worthy programs.
To us, Armed With a Camera is a program worth sustaining. Through it,
have afforded new and returning filmmakers the opportunity to
challenge themselves through total immersion into digital cinema
production. Our AWC alumni have gone on to produce feature-length films,
initiate their own arts education initiatives for emerging media
artists, and jump-start a national movement for
Armed With a Camera is emblematic of Visual Communications’ long
heritage of supporting and nurturing Asian Pacific American filmmakers and
Since we first organized Armed With a Camera back in 2002, filmmakers in
droves have jumped onto the digital bandwagon and made their own films. And of
course, thanks to the internet, filmmakers have found ways of insuring their
own unique visions and voices find their audience.
that, Visual Communications hasn’t been around for more than four decades
living in the filmmaking “stone ages.” From celluloid film, to video, to
digital, Visual Communications has been a pioneer in empowering both new and
established filmmakers with the tools and the inspiration to be successful at
articulating their “voice” through film. We strongly feel that programs such as
Armed With a Camera enables filmmakers to develop and hone that “voice” and, in
turn, expand the full spectrum of our experiences, challenges, and successes in

America. 

To sustain the next cycle of the Armed With a Camera Fellowship for
Emerging Media Artists, we need to raise at least $50,000,
for up to ten (10) fellows, including a cash stipend, to produce a short digital film that will
premiere at the 2015 Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival.
of production and post-production equipment and supplies.

column2: as well as honoraria for workshop instructors in areas such

column1: as directing, cinematography, editing, sound editing.

If we exceed our goal, all additional money will go toward future AWC cycles!

A portion of your donations may be tax deductible!  Further, you may receive an online link to the AWC 2015 films, free tickets to the premiere screening, badges to our annual C3: Conference for Creative Content, and VIP Opening Night tickets to the 2015 LA Asian Pacific Film Festival screenings!

Even if you can’t contribute directly to the fundraiser, we still value
us to your own friends and supporters via your Facebook and Twitter accounts.  Utilize the hashtag #AWC2015 in your social media.
This is the first time that we at Visual Communications
have ever tried something like this. But with your support, we KNOW this

campaign will be a success.

Facebook: http://facebook.com/vconline
Twitter: http://twitter.com/vconline
Tumblr: http://vconline.tumblr.com/

Risks and challenges

Developing new products carries risks, from design problems to unexpected costs.
On our past campaigns we have fought againts different inconveniences and we SOLVED them!
Thanks to the support of our backers we are here for our 3rd Campaign.
In the last years our team worked hard to create a solid structure around the Dreampick brand.
We registered our trademark and we patented our products.
What we need again is your help to continue developing new innovative products.
Everything is ready for the production and our manufacturer team is waiting for your response.
We kept our promises on our past campaigns and we are going to keep them with QUIST.
Will you help us again?

<div>ROV means remotely operated vehicle. The CCROV is an underwater robot with
a 4K camera, allowing user to shoot underwater photos and videos.
CCROV is mainly used to shoot underwater images and videos. It can dive up
to 100 meters (328 feet) deep, and will stream live HD video on your phone or
tablet. The CCROV can be used for further exploration such as dive site
inspection, wildlife surveillance, wreck detection, general adventure aid and
Why the CCROV? What makes the CCROV
The main differences between CCROV and other underwater robot are the
material, the camera and the number of thrusters. We used a built-in 4K camera to ensure the high
quality of photos and videos. As for the body of the robot, we selected a
special macromolecular and anti-corrosion material to make <b style=""background-color: initial
column3: >to protect the camera and main controller. The 6 thrusters allow 5 degrees of freedom and a high manoeuverability.

column1: · How to use the CCROV
Take the CCROV out of the box, connect the
cable to the robot, turn on the battery and the controller, connect it to the
APP, then put the robot into water, and use the joystick to operate it.
What can I do with the app?
The app can be downloaded from the App Store
and the Google Play Store. It gives you live video feedback on your
phone/tablet, allows you to take pictures and videos and display information
· How do I know when the CCROV is running out of power?
When the battery life reaches 20%, the APP will display a Low Battery warning.
You can guide the CCROV back to you or pull the cable if the battery dies. The
cable can resist a 100kg pull force so you do not need to worry about breaking
Take the battery out of the Tether Deployment System (TDS) to charge it.
One full charge takes around 90 minutes.
· Can the diver use the CCROV underwater?
At this stage the CCROV has to be controlled from the shore, but we are currently
working on the development of an accessory allowing an underwater control.
We provide a 12 months warranty for manufacturing defects. Free
repairs and component replacements will be provided under the warranty period
for manufacturing defects. The warranty doesn’t cover misuse of the product,
human factors, surface damages, bumps or scratches.
If I have questions, how can I reach your team?
Please read through the FAQ first to find your answer. We are receiving a
lot of special requests, and are responding as fast as possible!
For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com.
For all other questions regarding the CCROV, please kindly contact us
","The underwater world has drawn more and more attention over the past few years.

After realizing that there was no option for a high-quality professional camera or ROV at a reasonable price for the general consumer, we decided to develop a professional grade underwater drone at the
“It's a seriously precise drone, too, being manoeuvrable to within 1 square metre where most ROVs need an area three times that size in order to complete a circle.”Joe Svetlik, Trusted Reviews
“Designed for both research and recreational use, the CCROV
allows scuba divers to share their adventure with guests on board as well as
professionally document their discoveries with the option to connect an FPV or
VR headset to experience the footage in 3D.” 5

A remotely operated underwater vehicle (ROV) is

a tethered underwater mobile device. They are common in deep water industries. We created a ROV which is mainly used for underwater photography. The CCROV (CC=See the Sea) with its 4K camera, 6 thrusters and 5 degrees of freedom,
As for now, most underwater drones or robots use HD (720P) or 1080P
camera, but we aim for the highest quality of video footage, this is why we
decided to equip the CCROV with a 4K camera.This built-in camera will
help you get the clearest underwater videos and photos.
A ROV usually have 3 to 4 thrusters. To enjoy a
horizontal and 2 vertical thrusters on the CCROV.
The 6 thrusters provide the CCROV 5 degrees of freedom: forward & back,
up & down, right & left, yaw and the roll axis will automatically
adjust in response to the IMU statues.
Its flexible mobility and precise control make the CCROV maneuverable
within 1m³. With an average of 3 thrusters, most ROV will need three times that
The CCROV’s electronic components are placed in an aluminum alloy sealed compartment that can resist high water
pressure. This compartment is embedded in military
grade syntactic foam that not only provides stability but also avoids
erosion from sea water.This system assures the impermeability of the CCROV up to 100 meters deep.
The CCROV has a professional tether

deployment system that allows an easy packing and transportation. The  battery is located in the Tether Deployment System, it is removable and can be replaced while it's charging (90 minutes for a full charge) for an uninterrupted use of your CCROV. The tether’s
length ranges from 20 meters to 100 meters, and no matter the length, this
system makes it easy to manage.
Here is what the CCROV has to offer
Here are some use cases for the CCROV
Check diving spotsSwim along with the divers Follow diversInspect boat before sailing awayThe CCROV was used for shooting the International Free Diving Championship
The free diving champion (Jessea Lu with the CCROV)Vacation with family in Malaysia
professional ROV, it is still very portable.
It can be easily carried in a backpack or a suitcase, even placed under your
Take it along anywhere you go! Easy to use and ready to dive right out of
CCROV is easy to set up and user friendly, in three steps you are good to go:
-  Download and install the app (iOS and
Connect your phone (and the controller if you want to use it) to the Tether
Open the app and in one click, connect it to the CCROV.
The CCROV will send live video feedback through the tether up to the
surface. The signal will then be streamed by Wi-Fi from the Tether Deployment
Our company has experience in providing video transmission modules designed
for drones, so high speed and HD video transmission is kind of our advantage.
We take a step further with Virtual Reality! Your CCROV will take you
through a real life experience under water. Swim in the ocean with a school of
fish in glorious 3-D, flow with the stream and discover the underwater world.
We will have different colors available. For now we have apple green and lemon
yellow prototypes and if you want new colors then we will personalize it for
you! Get your own customized CCROV!
The price of an underwater camera with 1080P video is usually above USD 1,000
and the professional ROVs are usually more than USD 20,000.
We aim for the best quality and want to provide a professional experience while being at the lowest possible price.
If you want to be a part of the project and help us bring the CCROV to life, you can back this project here and receive your own CCROV at a huge discount from the retail price!
Here is how you can help us, every supporters matters!

ROV means remotely operated vehicle. The CCROV is an underwater robot with
a 4K camera, allowing user to shoot underwater photos and videos.
CCROV is mainly used to shoot underwater images and videos. It can dive up
to 100 meters (328 feet) deep, and will stream live HD video on your phone or
tablet. The CCROV can be used for further exploration such as dive site
inspection, wildlife surveillance, wreck detection, general adventure aid and
Why the CCROV? What makes the CCROV
The main differences between CCROV and other underwater robot are the
material, the camera and the number of thrusters. We used a built-in 4K camera to ensure the high
quality of photos and videos. As for the body of the robot, we selected a
special macromolecular and anti-corrosion material to make it stick firmly to protect the camera and main controller. The 6 thrusters allow 5 degrees of freedom and a high manoeuverability.
Take the CCROV out of the box, connect the
cable to the robot, turn on the battery and the controller, connect it to the
APP, then put the robot into water, and use the joystick to operate it.
What can I do with the app?
The app can be downloaded from the App Store
and the Google Play Store. It gives you live video feedback on your
phone/tablet, allows you to take pictures and videos and display information
· How do I know when the CCROV is running out of power?
When the battery life reaches 20%, the APP will display a Low Battery warning.
You can guide the CCROV back to you or pull the cable if the battery dies. The
cable can resist a 100kg pull force so you do not need to worry about breaking
How do I charge the CCROV?
Take the battery out of the Tether Deployment System (TDS) to charge it.
One full charge takes around 90 minutes.
· Can the diver use the CCROV underwater?
At this stage the CCROV has to be controlled from the shore, but we are currently
working on the development of an accessory allowing an underwater control.

repairs and component replacements will be provided under the warranty period
for manufacturing defects. The warranty doesn’t cover misuse of the product,

column1: Forget those moments when clicking a group photo is a difficult task, done in installments and always needing to edit the photo. You can take good group pic without losing any of your friends in a pic.
Most mobile phones have a low quality front camera. Using EmoFix, you can capture photos and videos using the back camera of your phone, which is usually much higher quality than the front camera.

No App Needed

EmoFix does not require an App to work. It is a stand alone device that simply connects through your phone via Bluetooth, and works on any phone including iPhone and Android.
Great Selfie Remote with Best Bluetooth Range
EmoFix connects to your mobile remotely via Bluetooth and has a range of 30 feet, which is more than enough for clicking most pics and videos.
EmoFix is made of a special metal alloy that makes it more durable. You can drop it on a hard surface and nothing will happen to the device.
Everything around you is stylish, why not your selfie remote as well. The laconic design gives a very attractive trendy look to your EmoFix.
We Paid Great Attention to Detail on EmoFix
It feels good when you put your heart into  making something. We are very proud of EmoFix, and kept every tiny detail in mind to make it perfect.
Why We Made This Selfie Remote, Emofix?

We saw the problems that people would have while taking selfies and group pics. We have dealt with the problem too. We have also watched people take videos, that they couldn't be in, even though they were an important part of the group. They have to be at the other side of the camera. We thought, why not create something so that the person who is on the other side should come in the scene and enjoy the moment with others. After all, they were there too so why shouldn't the pic or video capture the memory with everyone involved.

We can be part of a good selfie, a perfect group photo or an adventurous video. That’s when we started thinking of a device to make this happen and EmoFix was born as the absolute best selfie remote. We brainstormed a lot to give it a perfect stylish design and great technical features. We made it waterproof because you can’t take your mobile phone in the water.

We made it durable with strong metal so that nothing would happen even if you drop it on the ground. We are continuously thinking of ways to make it better. So that we can give our users a better experience in the future.

EmoFix is the brainchild of industry experienced professionals, who have been engaged in innovative tech products for a long time. The team consists of creative product designers, hard working techies and visionary management
column2: who all work relentlessly to provide the best user experience.

column1: To make this product available to the maximum number of people, we are launching on Indiegogo. We need your help to start the production process.

Does it work with front and rear camera?
Yes. EmoFix is working with the camera that you choose on your smart phone.
Can I have my EmoFix shipped to different address?
With what smart phone EmoFix can be used?
EmoFix can be used with all Android (version 4.4 or above) and with all iPhones (iOS 7 or above).
What the detailed technical characteristics of EmoFix?
Power life: over 2 years for 30 photos each day
Time to auto power-off: 60mins for iPhone/1.5mins for Android Phone
How EmoFix start shooting photos from my smart phone?
After connection you should turn on camera app on your smart phone and than use EmoFix.

Those of you who know me, now that I love photography, so much so that I am willing to drag thousands of dollars of heavy and expensive equipment through often, eh, challenging conditions  (Mardi Gras, Burning Man, LIB, Bicycle Day etc) to capture the beauty of my tribe and surroundings at their fullest potential. You will also know that I rarely ask for any compensation, and take great pleasure at seeing these photographs shared and reposted in the Greater World.

I am asked constantly why I take such risks with my equipment, and my answer is, thats how you get the best shots. In this spirit, this last Mardi Gras I rented a $3000 lens (14mm 2.8L), and of course, for the first time ever, my camera took a fall, my flash was smashed, and the lens badly damaged.

Despite having insurance on the lens, the total for these repairs (and the rental) is close to $1000. Since this amount seems like a lot for any years Mardi Gras photos (even though they are pretty damned good if I do say so myself!) I thought, for the first time ever, I would ask my friends, tribe, and fans, to help me with this unfortunate and unexpected expense so that I can keep shooting for you all without doubt or fear.
column2: >Over the next two months of this campaign I will not only be releasing hundreds of photos taken over this past Mardi Gras - including Krewe de Vieux, Chewbaccus, MOMS Ball,
column3: > Krewe de Lune, Box of Wine, and Fat Tuesday - but I'm also going to make an effort to release hundreds of photos that have been waiting from over a dozen previous Mardi Gras, Halloweens, Burning Man's, Bicycle Day,
column4: >transformational festivals, and much much more!

column6: > a profile shot donated $10, I would be able to pay for the damages with ease. And this is also your chance to buy a piece of my work, or to get that custom print off of me that you have always wanted ... if you can show me the shot, I will dig through all my files to find the one you want.
column7: >Please help me to keep my photography
column8:
> free! Any excess funds will be applied towards the fore-mentioned $3000 wide-angle dream lens ...

","Those of you who know me, now that I love photography, so much so that I am willing to drag thousands of dollars of heavy and expensive equipment through often, eh, challenging conditions  (Mardi Gras, Burning Man, LIB, Bicycle Day etc) to capture the beauty of my tribe and surroundings at their fullest potential. You will also know that I rarely ask for any compensation, and take great pleasure at seeing these photographs shared and reposted in the Greater World.I am asked constantly why I take such risks with my equipment, and my answer is, thats how you get the best shots. In this spirit, this last Mardi Gras I rented a $3000 lens (14mm 2.8L), and of course, for the first time ever, my camera took a fall, my flash was smashed, and the lens badly damaged.Despite having insurance on the lens, the total for these repairs (and the rental) is close to $1000. Since this amount seems like a lot for any years Mardi Gras photos (even though they are pretty damned good if I do say so myself!) I thought, for the first time ever, I would ask my friends, tribe, and fans, to help me with this unfortunate and unexpected expense so that I can keep shooting for you all without doubt or fear.Over the next two months of this campaign I will not only be releasing hundreds of photos taken over this past Mardi Gras - including Krewe de Vieux, Chewbaccus, MOMS Ball, Krewe de Lune, Box of Wine, and Fat Tuesday - but I'm also going to make an effort to release hundreds of photos that have been waiting from over a dozen previous Mardi Gras, Halloweens, Burning Man's, Bicycle Day, transformational festivals, and much much more!If you tag one of these photos, please post my Indie Go-Go campaign with that tag. If everyone who uses (or has used) one of my photos as a profile shot donated $10, I would be able to pay for the damages with ease. And this is also your chance to buy a piece of my work, or to get that custom print off of me that you have always wanted ... if you can show me the shot, I will dig through all my files to find the one you want. Please help me to keep my photography free! Any excess funds will be applied towards the fore-mentioned $3000 wide-angle dream lens ...",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

Capture amazing images in any conditions and get complete control of your DSLR or mirrorless camera—all from your smartphone.

column2:
>

Arsenal is the world’s first intelligent assistant for DSLR and mirrorless cameras. Ultralight hardware lets you wirelessly control your camera with an intuitive iOS or Android app. And advanced machine learning algorithms help you get the perfect shot every time.
column4:
>

 With a single tap, you can activate Arsenal’s settings assistant AI. The settings assistant is trained on thousands of great photos. It can determine the optimal settings for the scene you're shooting. Next it fine tunes those settings using 18 different environmental factors. The result is great settings for any shot.
column5:
>

 Like your own personal photography assistant, Arsenal lets you focus on the parts of photography you love while it takes care of the rest.
column7:
>

Arsenal lets you control your camera from up to 100 feet away. Set the shutter speed, aperture, and ISO, see a live preview, and trigger the shutter from your smartphone.
column8:
>

 Arsenal automates advanced photo stacking techniques to help you capture scenes with High Dynamic Range (HDR). In seconds, you can take multiple exposures and merge them into a single RAW or JPG file on your camera—no post-production required.
column10:
>

 With focus stacking, you can get your entire scene in sharp focus. Arsenal calculates the optimal number of exposures, takes them at different focus positions, and merges them into one crystal clear image.
column12:
>

 With Arsenal, you can create long exposures that capture rich color and dramatic motion blurs...without buying expensive neutral density filters.
column15:
>

We love timelapses, so we designed the best timelapse interface on the planet. Set your parameters, then ask Arsenal to adjust the exposure in changing light for a smooth day-to-night transition. You can even preview your timelapse while it’s being recorded.

Once you start your timelapse, Arsenal takes care of the rest. You (and your phone) can leave your camera working. Come back anytime to check on the progress or make adjustments while the scene is still being captured.
column16:
wmode=transparent"" width=""612"">

Check out some of the timelapses we've shot with Arsenal
column18:
>

Let’s face it, reviewing images on your camera’s tiny screen is never fun. With Arsenal, you can review them wirelessly on your phone. Flip through photos instantly, zoom in to see details at full-resolution, then share favorites right from your phone.
column19:
>

Arsenal fully supports dozens of popular DSLR and mirrorless camera models made by Canon, Nikon, Sony, and Fuji. To see if your camera will be supported when we launch, visit our Supported Cameras page.

Arsenal controls your camera via a USB cable (included), and you control Arsenal wirelessly from your smartphone. Arsenal’s free mobile app will be compatible with modern iOS and Android devices.
column21:
>
 

Arsenal’s intelligent algorithm suggests settings based on your subject and environment. Then like any good assistant, it lets you control the final shot. Here’s how it works:

column1: • Compares current scene with thousands of past images using a convolutional deep neural network. (The same algorithm used in self driving cars)
• Avoids settings that produce weak images on your specific camera and lens
• Uses image recognition to identify subject-specific needs (e.g. fast shutter for birds)
• Shows safe ranges for each setting based on situational constraints (e.g. vibration)
• Gives you the ability to change the settings you care about most
P.S. The term “artificial intelligence” (AI) gets thrown around a lot these days, so we put together a blog post explaining how Arsenal’s algorithms work in more detail.
• Charge while in use (with any USB-compatible battery pack, not included)

column3:
>
 

Hi, my name is Ryan. I’m a software developer, amateur landscape photographer, and the creator of Arsenal.

Arsenal started as a side project to automate my own photography techniques. Once I started showing other photographers the photos I was getting, there was so much interest that I decided to create something everyone could use.

Getting Arsenal from idea to reality has been a tremendous team effort. I’ve worked on it full time for more than a year in collaboration with an electrical engineer who specializes in device design, a brilliant user interface designer (who also happens to be my brother), and other key roles. Arsenal is now ready for production, and we’re so excited to share what we’ve built with the Indiegogo community.

If you’d like to see some of the shots I’ve been getting with Arsenal, you can find me on Instagram @ryanstout.

column1: • Follow us on Instagram / Facebook / Twitter

column3: > ","Capture amazing images in any conditions and get complete control of your DSLR or mirrorless camera—all from your smartphone.

column1: Arsenal is the world’s first intelligent assistant for DSLR and mirrorless cameras. Ultralight hardware lets you wirelessly control your camera with an intuitive iOS or Android app. And advanced machine learning algorithms help you get the perfect shot every time.  With a single tap, you can activate Arsenal’s settings assistant AI. The settings assistant is trained on thousands of great photos. It can determine the optimal settings for the scene you're shooting. Next it fine tunes those settings using 18 different environmental factors. The result is great settings for any shot. Like your own personal photography assistant, Arsenal lets you focus on the parts of photography you love while it takes care of the rest. Arsenal lets you control your camera from up to 100 feet away. Set the shutter speed, aperture, and ISO, see a live preview, and trigger the shutter from your smartphone.  Arsenal automates advanced photo stacking techniques to help you capture scenes with High Dynamic Range (HDR). In seconds, you can take multiple exposures and merge them into a single RAW or JPG file on your camera—no post-production required.  With focus stacking, you can get your entire scene in sharp focus. Arsenal calculates the optimal number of exposures, takes them at different focus positions, and merges them into one crystal clear image.  With Arsenal, you can create long exposures that capture rich color and dramatic motion blurs...without buying expensive neutral density filters.  We love timelapses, so we designed the best timelapse interface on the planet. Set your parameters, then ask Arsenal to adjust the exposure in changing light for a smooth day-to-night transition. You can even preview your timelapse while it’s being recorded.Once you start your timelapse, Arsenal takes care of the rest. You (and your phone) can leave your camera working. Come back anytime to check on the progress or make adjustments while the scene is still being captured.Check out some of the timelapses we've shot with Arsenal  Let’s face it, reviewing images on your camera’s tiny screen is never fun. With Arsenal, you can review them wirelessly on your phone. Flip through photos instantly, zoom in to see details at full-resolution, then share favorites right from your phone. Arsenal fully supports dozens of popular DSLR and mirrorless camera models made by Canon, Nikon, Sony, and Fuji. To see if your camera will be supported when we launch, visit our Supported Cameras page.Arsenal controls your camera via a USB cable (included), and you control Arsenal wirelessly from your smartphone. Arsenal’s free mobile app will be compatible with modern iOS and Android devices.   Arsenal’s intelligent algorithm suggests settings based on your subject and environment. Then like any good assistant, it lets you control the final shot. Here’s how it works:
Compares current scene with thousands of past images using a convolutional deep neural network. (The same algorithm used in self driving cars)
Optimizes settings based on 18 different factors
Avoids settings that produce weak images on your specific camera and lens
Uses image recognition to identify subject-specific needs (e.g. fast shutter for birds)
Shows safe ranges for each setting based on situational constraints (e.g. vibration)
Gives you the ability to change the settings you care about most
P.S. The term “artificial intelligence” (AI) gets thrown around a lot these days, so we put together a blog post explaining how Arsenal’s algorithms work in more detail.
Charge while in use (with any USB-compatible battery pack, not included)

column1: - YouTube: Click here to view.
- Google Drive: Click here to download.
Z CAM open API is available here : https://github.com/imaginevision
Would you ship Z CAM S1 to my country? What is the shipping cost?

We have expanded shipping to many countries, using FedEx International Economy or equivalent solutions. So chances are Z CAM E1 is probably available for shipping to your country. Please select your perk and enter your country to view the availability and shipping cost. If you do not find your country in the selection, please contact us at support@imvt.com .

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT? 

The backer is responsible. Please check your country's import duties before purchasing.

When will Z CAM S1 be shipped?

We will start to ship small quantity in November, and large volume shipment in December.

How do I know my order status?

We will send you email to inform you the status. Once shipped, we will send you the tracking number.

What video stitching software can be used with Z CAM S1?

There are many video stitching software available in the market. But we also provide a 360° video stitching software,  which offers both real time and offline stitching (automatic and optical flow based).

What is the resolution of Z CAM S1? How to select it?

The default resolution of Z CAM S1 is 4K 30fps per image sensor, with all four image sensor, it would give a 6K 30fps spherical resolution output after stitching. By putting a special configuration file onto each of the SD card, the resolution of Z CAM S1 can be changed to 2.7K 60fps, which would give a 4K 60fps spherical resolution output after stitching. Once used, Z CAM S1 would memorize the new resolution until another configuration file is put into the SD card to change it. Both 4K and 2.7K configuration files will be available to download soon.

What can I do with the Ethernet port on Z CAM S1?

Since we provide full set open API (please click here to download the full document), expert users can control and set the Z CAM S1 through the Ethernet port, in addition to retrieve image files and live view possibilities through external solutions.

What is the input voltage of Z CAM S1’s power adapter? What is the power plug standard?

The input voltage of Z CAM S1 AC/DC power adapter is 100~240V. We provide three power plugs in the standard package, which would suit US, EU, UK and China standard.

Is battery included? What battery cell is Z CAM S1 using?

There is a battery compartment but we do not provide battery cells in the standard package. Four standard 18650 Li-ion rechargeable battery cells are required for battery unit operation. 

What kind of SD card should be used? What is the maximum capacity supported?

We highly recommend to use SDXC class 10 memory card for best performance. We support up to 128G SD card.

How accurate is our Z CAM Sync?

We used flashgun to test our synchronization. As you can see from this photo, it's the 3067th frame of a video feed, the starting line of the flash exposed on all four sensors are precisely the same. It is evident that we can achieve line level sync accuracy.

What is the Z CAM 360º Video Stitching Software?

We want VR content creators to be able to concentrate on creation of contents and no need to bother with the technical limitations. They can rely on our video stitching solution. 

Based on our current alogorithm, our software can stitch without visible seam when objects come across from one lens direction to another. We have been working on optical flow based stitching software development and made very good progress so far.

We will post some footages by our automatic stitching software soon.

We welcome challenges. Let's record and stitch some challenging scenes and be convinced.

How can I use the Stitching Software?

Before you shoot, just set up the camera in position, check the view angle using the live view through etherent, and just hit the record button. 

When you get back, connect the camera to the computer via ethernet, select the image files in batch and one click to stitch. After the stitching process, you will get a seamlessly stitched video file for your post processing work flow. :)

0,"

FEATURED ON

WHAT IS STARSLIDER

Starslider is not only a camera gear but also an entire ecosystem of professional video equipment. Our goal was to realize the perfect bundle, capable of satisfying any videomaker's needs in terms of camera movements: from a simple manual control to triple motorization control. It enables you to produce complex shootings or timelapse easily, thanks to the simplest remote control you already have in the pocket: your smartphone! 

 

WHAT ARE THE KEY FEATURES

MODULARITY AND FLEXIBILITY

We design several solutions to provide easy plug of each element. In order to construct any specific set, every module is match-able mutually with the others in various way.
column3:
'/>

 

V-SHAPE CONNECTIONS

The V shape of our connection systems is the best way to eliminate any backlash, resulting in a unique solid piece that allows impeccably smooth movements.
column5:
'/>

 

 

MOTOR MAGNETIC PLUG

The system is equiped with a unique plug and play motor coupling solution that allows the fastest mounting capability on the market.
column7:
'/>

 

THE APP

Starslider can be controlled by an accompanying app for  iOS, OSX and Android, that allows live control and configuration of preset, timelapse and stop motion. Set your start and your end points, add keyframes where you want and input duration/intervals/speed to suit:

You have the ability to apply bezier curves for smoother moves, loop, save for repeatability, and bulb ramping.

column1:
LIVE CTRL

Live motion allows you to control real time moving three axes at different speeds and accelerations.

PRESET CTRL

If you want to accurately design your shot you have to meet Starslider Preset Control. You can save and reload the same transition to shot it again in the same or different situations. 

 

The Preset Control allows you to set multiple key-frames at different positions of the camera. Our algorythm calculates the interpolation and does the rest: it makes the transition smooth and guarantees fluid dynamics from the start to the end.
column3:
'/>

 

 

TIMELAPSE

Timelapse mode allows you to set the transition - the same way of Presets - using pictures instead video recordings. The Control Unit can communicate directly with your camera thanks to the universal shutter release cable, and you can set everything you need on your device.

 

TECHNICAL SPECS 

THE CONTROL UNIT

 The control unit is the brain and the heart of the project. The power source is a battery with a standard V-lock adapter or a generic power supply. There are 3 output ports (12v, 7.2v, 5v) to feed your device, monitor, or other tools
column4: 4 Ethernet connections to control the motors, and an intervalometer plug to control timelapse.

column1:
DEMO

We want to demonstrate how fast and easy is to take control of Starslider.

In 2 minutes you can.. take your smartphone, go to wifi settings, connect to STARLSIDER, go to the application, launch it, select Live Control, play with default settings, change speed, increase acceleration, play again with Live Control, go back to the menu, choose Preset Mode, point a target moving three axis, set a keypoint, move the camera along starslider, point the focus again on the target moving pan and tilt, set the end point, play the transition - too fast - increase the duration, playback the transition. Ok, that's awesome! 

In only two minutes.

 

GET WHAT YOU NEED AND DON'T FORGET THE EXTRAS.

Do you desire extended features? The add-ons allow you to easily carry on your new flexible equipment or simply to extend the potentiality of it. Choose what you prefer and contact us to add the amount to your pledge.

TEAM

We are a team of young professionals in the field of industrial design and industrial production, with a passion for videomaking. We developed Starslider to respond to two requests:a tool that allows the videomaker to produce interviews by himself (with the assistance of a remote control) and a robotic arm to make a product's video. We started our journey with these specific needs, working with talented engineers and collaborating with filmmakers &
column2:
photographers in order to improve, prototype after prototype, our vision and product.

“A good tool shouldn't be complicated or too expensive to utilize, whether you are a professional or an enthusiast, everyone has the possibility to realize their creativity.”  

Product Designer - Marco Farmachidi

Industrial Engineer - Giovanni Schirinzi

Mechanical Designer - Michele Salamone

UX Designer - Gionata Fronduti

 

Electronic and Software Engineer - Nazmus Sakib

Electronic and Software Engineer - Luay Yari

Front-end, App Development - Pietro Di Costanzo

Strategy Consulting  - Viola Xu

Comunication &
column3:
PR - Filippo Rebuzzini

Videomaker -  Andrea Revelli

Photographer - Marco Verna, Gabriele Daccardi

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We have already secured trusted partners in order to ensure the project flows as planned. The production includes several components with a high precision and complex proprietary electronics
column4:
therefore while we don't foresee any complications, potential supply chain issues or tweaking in the design may occur. We'll keep the community informed with prompt updates.

Choose what you prefer and contact us to add the amount to your pledge.TEAMWe are a team of young professionals in the field of industrial design and industrial production, with a passion for videomaking. We developed Starslider to respond to two requests:a tool that allows the videomaker to produce interviews by himself (with the assistance of a remote control) and a robotic arm to make a product's video. We started our journey with these specific needs, working with talented engineers and collaborating with filmmakers & photographers in order to improve, prototype after prototype, our vision and product.“A good tool shouldn't be complicated or too expensive to utilize, whether you are a professional or an enthusiast, everyone has the possibility to realize their creativity.”  Product Designer - Marco FarmachidiIndustrial Engineer - Giovanni SchirinziMechanical Designer - Michele SalamoneUX Designer - Gionata Fronduti Electronic and Software Engineer - Nazmus SakibElectronic and Software Engineer - Luay YariFront-end, App Development - Pietro Di CostanzoStrategy Consulting  - Viola XuComunication & PR - Filippo RebuzziniVideomaker -  Andrea RevelliPhotographer - Marco Verna, Gabriele Daccardi RISKS AND CHALLENGESWe have already secured trusted partners in order to ensure the project flows as planned. The production includes several components with a high precision and complex proprietary electronics

Story

For those who seek lasting value of the things. For those who believe that things are not disposable and neither are people. For those who see the world through their own aperture, speed and sensitivity.

Technology

Combining latest 3D modeling and 3D printing technology with classic photography techniques? Resurrection of old masters approaches? Want to be part of this? So fund the project and share this experience with us!

Goal

To convert ""machine gun"" shooting of digital images into real joy from every picture done right inside the camera. To provide the experience from pure essence of photographic work - aperture, speed and sensitivity. To build a brand of high quality 3D printable cameras.
column3:
/>

Camera

We had a battle with trials and errors on the journey to develop 3D printable large format camera for last 18 months. Many daytime hours and overnight shifts have been spent to find easiest possible design suitable for 3D printing using world widespread FDM 3D printing technology. Finally we are introducing durable, foolproof and 3D printable 4x5 large format camera.

Features

Robust design optimized for 3D printing from ABS filament. Imaging area almost 15 times bigger than 35mm full frame. Designed for Schneider Kreuznach Lenses mounted either on helical mount or directly on the lens board as fix-focused to infinity. Standard available focal lengths are 58 and 90 mm. Compatible with all currently available sheet film holders as well as with Polaroid 545 instant film holder for New55 instant 4×5 film. Two cold shoes for accessories, 1/4” – 20 tripod thread and carrying strap attachments. Dimensions 158x137x65 mm (camera body). Customized focal length design on demand.


Camera body options

Standard camera body is designed for Schneider Super Angulon 58 XL and 90 XL lenses. It requires Schneider Helical Mount for precise focusing (sold separately). 

Fixed focused camera body is designed for Schneider Super Angulon 58 XL and 90 XL lens focused to infinity. It does not require Schneider Helical Mount. It has focus range from 3 meter to infinity depending on selected aperture. 

Custom design body is available either for focal lengths 72 mm, 100 mm, 120 mm and 150 mm as standard body or any focal length up to 180 mm as fix focused camera body.

For more information check project website: www.ivancak-cameras.com

Please note: Schneider lens, viewfinder and sheet film holder are third party products not funded by this campaign. ","StoryFor those who seek lasting value of the things. Documenting Dystopia sounds like the title of a book or movie. It is the actually the name of a website born out of the vision of a man who had noticed the significant, rapid increase in the number of surveillance cameras all over the country. He realized that this is a red flag that warns us of the impending elimination of the Fourth Amendment.
At the same time, he realized that the American People haven’t a clue about what is happening because most media outlets are not reporting on stories like these.
Documenting Dystopia was born out of a dire and obvious need for government transparency, especially involving the surveillance of lawful citizens.
In August 2012, the story of an orwellian surveillance software known as Trapwire, began to make waves across independant media, thanks the ""GI FILES"" from Wikileaks.

Out of disgust with the increasingly powerful surveillance state, that in many cases seems intent to silence free speech demonstrators, I created a collaborative google map called #TrackingTrapwire, with the intention of locating and exposing the location of the surveillance systems.
Within less than a month we had received over a hundred thousand hits to the map.
This initial idea quickly expanded into what is now as Documenting Dystopia, which has over 2450 cameras in 4 countries and growing. Users are submitting pictures of cameras in their local areas.

Currently, anyone can send in pictures of surveillance cameras for us to pin on the map. This can be done using location data stored in the picture on a smart phone, or users can map the cameras themselves easily in Google Earth, and then send us their map.  We are working to automate this process in secure and efficient methods
We currently have a programmer developing an app for the Android marketplace that will make the submission process easy and fun for everyone who is participating.

Funded properly, Documenting Dystopia will become a driving force for transparency in public surveillance systems. Through public exposure, incentivized camera finding, and petitioning, we could make the public much more aware of the dangers that our surveillance state presents, and get them engaged and active in supporting the transparency we seek.

Additionally, by creating a public service camera directory we would be dividing up the power of ""big brother"" and even those in the upper echelons of law enforcement and intelligence agencies, would be subject to the prying eyes of the cameras as everyday citizens become able to look through those same eyes.
I'm prepared to devote all my time &
column2: energy into this project, making it a full time job, and I am looking to expand the project in many ways, and now I need your help!

column1: • This includes myself and one or two team members traveling to high population areas around the United States to inform and engage the public with demonstrations, and all while maintaining an interactive blog/vlog and submitting cameras that we find along the way.
• Expand our future app release to the App Store on Apple devices.
• Spread awareness of the scope of the surveillance state both in the United States, and abroad, expanding our community and outreach.

• Create petition kits for different regions to petition local, state, and federal governments to open the feeds of surveillance cameras to the public, and provide camera lists to add to the database, preferably by creating petition kits for different regions to work with.
• Enhance the interactivity, functionality, and security of the camera directory.
<li>Incentivise camera finders through regular prizes for top submitters.
• Covering recent news on issues involving totalitarianism, tyranny, dehumanization, environmental Disaster, and information Control, the 5 major themes of a Dystopian ""fiction.""

My handle is by Seek Veracity. I am a former employee of a large bank, and was also a founding organizer of OccupyMaine in Portland, Maine.  I believe that surveillance cameras, though a useful technology, like many innovations are being misused by those in power.

I have focused my efforts to Documenting Dystopia after seeing how my government and others are using federal and local law enforcement, as well as judicial systems, to systematically harass, arrest and injure peaceful citizens, especially those involved in Occupy Wall Street protests.
examples:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=45VGFgiFu7Y
You can help bring awareness to our cause, and this fundraiser by referring friends, family, activists, and others to our website and donation campaign. Use the indiegogo referral links preferably.
In addition, if you want to help build the camera directory, please join the forum, or become a camera finder.

Please listen to my speech, ""A Dystopian Reality""
http://youtu.be/IiD_vxH5c5Q

Here is a writing from a fellow Occupier:
http://tinyurl.com/chn4s29

Photography has always been a huge hobby for me. I've always found solace or joy in getting out and taking photos.

Now that I have lost some of my vision, there is a lot that I find difficult to do. And even though photography is one of them, it is one of the few activities that I still can enjoy despite the new limitations I have in my life.

The goal I have set would cover:

• A new camera and lenses
• Corresponding equipment (a shutter release cable, lens hood, lens filters, lens cloth, lens hood, and a few other needed items)
• Memory cards
• New editing software for my computer
• Money will be earmarked for printing and framing costs, space rental fees for photo shoots, and any unexpected costs.

Thanks to the massive success of the campaign, the tuck boxes will receive gold and silver foil stamping and embossing. (To be confirmed for the PVC variant as I am exploring a waterproof tuck box)
The community had expressed the desire for an EXTRA waterproof PVC variant (third color). You asked and you shall receive.
Imagine a super useful camera reference sheet which is printed on a deck of uniquely designed playing cards
Each numbered card illustrates the most important rules and techniques about photography. Each of the court cards has uniquely designed camera artwork.
Think of them as pocket-sized cheat sheets that you can bring wherever you travel.
The info on the cards can be combined so you will have everything you need for ANY shooting situation.

The cards make a unique gift for anyone who likes cameras. No matter if you are shooting on a compact, mirrorless, DSLR or even your smartphone: This is the perfect travel companion and addition for your camera bag.
I condensed the most relevant and important information and I am super confident that I created a unique and useful product.
Each of the suits contains one of the four different categories of information:
HEARTS are dedicated to Composition. The most important principles and techniques such as negative space, symmetry, patterns, leading lines, depth &
column2: layers, framing, rule of odds, rule of thirds, fibonacci &amp
column3: golden ratio are explained in custom designed illustrations.

column1: SPADES are dedicated to Camera Basics. These cards illustrate standard principles such as the exposure triangle, aperture, shutter speed, ISO, focal length, depth-of-field, shooting modes, sensor size and exposure interval.

CLUBS are dedicated to Technicals. I collated the most important topics such as manual shooting, white balance, color theory, understanding and reading a histogram, understanding the different types of filters, metering modes, RAW &
column2: JPG, focus modes and drive modes. Once again, all topics are described with custom illustrations.

column1: DIAMONDS describe different Shooting Styles and the most commonly used settings. I illustrated styles like flash photography, macro, sports &
I identified a top manufacturer to produce high quality cards that are really durable and have an elegant finish. I am confident that they can keep up with industry standard quality playing cards.

The deck has a micro linen finish which feels great in the hands. It is very lightweight yet durable and suitable for rapid shuffling or cardistry. The tuckbox is made from black cardboard which is sturdy and durable.
Hi, I’m Eric. I am a freelance photographer &

column3: Olga (Illustrators) for helping me with the artwork and special thanks to Sergio (Magician) for helping me with the shuffling and card tricks in the video!

Take Better Photos and Make People Crave Your Products Even If You Don't Own a Real Camera

You make something special. You make something that people will use, wear, and love. You need photos that make those customers crave what you're making, but where do you start? How do you do it without expensive camera gear?
Don't worry. I can make it easier.

Not everyone has access to expensive photography equipment, or has the resources to hire a professional photographer. But, with the right guidance and know-how, you can improve the quality of your own photos, and make your products look amazing.

What This Guide Isn't

This guide is NOT for professional photographers! Product Photos Made Simple is a How-To for busy small business owners and creatives who want better-quality photos with minimum fuss. This guide will give you the knowledge and techniques to get cleaner, more consistent product photos in less time. Even if all you have is a smartphone, you'll get tips you can use to make better photos easily.
A sneak preview of just some of what you'll learn:
• Lighting basics to help you get great shots without equipment
• Do's and Don'ts for getting consistent results
• Ways to control or even build lighting without stressing your budget
• The best photo apps for your phone, and how to use them to get the best possible results
• How to do product styling when you don't know where to begin
• When it might be time for you to hire a professional, and where to start
Learn From a Photographer Who's Been There.

I'm the Benevolent Overlord of Upswept Creative, a small-but-fierce creative studio in the heart of Portland, Oregon.  I capture bold editorial photos, crisp lookbook images, and clean product photography for established businesses.

I didn't always have the fancy camera gear, though--like a lot of early business owners, I had to seek out creative solutions. I've spent a decade experimenting both in-studio and on-location, learning about the fundamentals, and gaining the skills to capture eye-catching photos, every time, even on a shoestring budget.

Where the Funds Are Going

I believe in doing this How-To Guide to a high standard, so I want to deliver the best possible end product:

column2: >I want the techniques in this Guide to be ironclad, so we'll test our solutions and techniques with minimal equipment, so you'll know that they can work for you, too.

column1: • The Guide will be edited by our copywriter and content strategist, so it's as concise and easy-to-understand as possible.

column2: >The Guide will include custom-created photos, diagrams, and styling ideas, so you'll have visual aids to help you understand important concepts.
>If we reach full funding, we'll also create companion video content online to walk you through the basics, and make it available for as a Deluxe version of the Guide.

column1: <li>As owner of a creative agency, I care about design. A lot.
column2: ) So, the Upswept Creative team will put in the time and expertise to design a guide that's beautiful and easy to read and follow.

column1: What Happens If Full Funding Isn't Met?

Our big goal is to have this guide available in Fall of 2016. This way, all of you who are preparing for the holiday shopping season can use Product Photos Made Simple to make your products look better than ever! If we don't reach full funding, then we won't be able to complete this How-To Guide on the timeline we've set--we'll have to keep doing other work to meet our minimum income, so that means less time and energy to put towards the Guide.
We will also only be able to create the companion video walk-throughs if we meet full funding.

Still, even if we don't reach full funding, everything we do receive WILL be put towards making this e-book guide! The guide WILL come out, but it'll take longer. The more funding we get, the better and more comprehensive our final product will be, and the sooner we'll be able to complete it, so you can start using our knowledge for your own benefit!
Whether you can contribute or not, there are some free-and-easy ways you can help:
Share this campaign with other people you know who might benefit. We want to help as many small businesses as we can with this guide, so you boosting the signal is a big help for all of us!

Get a sneak peek at our pro tips by signing up for our list! We'll be sending out some basic tips to help you improve your photos, absolutely free! All you have to do is sign up. Or even better, share it with someone you know!: http://www.upsweptcreative.com/product-photos-made-simple/

Share our upcoming blog content with your friends and colleagues. We'll be giving a taste of the content we're developing for this guide over the next few weeks, on our blog. Follow our blog to keep up, and share our tips with others! http://www.upsweptcreative.com/blog/

column1: What Happens If Full Funding Isn't Met?

Our big goal is to have this guide available in Fall of 2016. This way, all of you who are preparing for the holiday shopping season can use Product Photos Made Simple to make your products look better than ever! If we don't reach full funding, then we won't be able to complete this How-To Guide on the timeline we've set--we'll have to keep doing other work to meet our minimum income, so that means less time and energy to put towards the Guide.
We will also only be able to create the companion video walk-throughs if we meet full funding.

Still, even if we don't reach full funding, everything we do receive WILL be put towards making this e-book guide! The guide WILL come out, but it'll take longer. The more funding we get, the better and more comprehensive our final product will be, and the sooner we'll be able to complete it, so you can start using our knowledge for your own benefit!
Whether you can contribute or not, there are some free-and-easy ways you can help:
Share this campaign with other people you know who might benefit. We want to help as many small businesses as we can with this guide, so you boosting the signal is a big help for all of us!

Get a sneak peek at our pro tips by signing up for our list! We'll be sending out some basic tips to help you improve your photos, absolutely free! All you have to do is sign up. Or even better, share it with someone you know!: http://www.upsweptcreative.com/product-photos-made-simple/

Share our upcoming blog content with your friends and colleagues. We'll be giving a taste of the content we're developing for this guide over the next few weeks, on our blog. Follow our blog to keep up, and share our tips with others! http://www.upsweptcreative.com/blog/",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column5: >My Car was broken into yesterday (Sept 7th 2013) and My Nikon D300, 2 lenses, and 8GB CF camera card were stolen. My insurance won't cover the personal property loss so the cost of replacing it is all on me. Unfortunately, I can't afford to replace my equipment and without my equipment I wont be able to complete my Photography portfolio class (and furthermore, if I don't complete this class, I wont be able to graduate) So, needless to say I am quite stressed out right now and need all the help I can get. every dollar is appreciated.
