As you know, Amy Gee is a well-known local photographer whose work artfully documents everything from fashion shows to cats sleeping on the couch. She has done work for local designers like Raul Osorio, publications like Vita.mn and even a lookbook for NYC-based designer Ra'mon-Lawrence Coleman. Those of us who know her well have watched her carefully develop her talent over the years. If you know Amy, you know her camera is her left arm. It goes with her everywhere.
Amy's car was recently stolen and destroyed. With it went her camera. Insurance will not cover the cost of the camera and everything else that was destroyed.

Replacing her camera is a costly endeavor and Amy needs a little help. Knowing that our community is a supportive one, especially for young artists, I set up this campaign so we could put our money where our mouths are and help her out.

Anything you can contribute would be much appreciated. We'd like to get Amy's hands on a camera as soon as we can!

Note (12/27/14): Sorry it has taken so long, but my goal is to get everything sent out by the first week of January.  Thanks for being patient, everybody!

Short Summary

If you're a fan of independent professional wrestling, you've seen his photos.  Pro Wrestling Guerrilla.  Ring of Honor.  Evolve.  Dragon Gate USA.  All Pro Wrestling.  Hoodslam.  Big Time Wrestling.  Championship Wrestling from Hollywood.  Gold Rush Pro Wrestling.  He's shot them all.

His photos have been tweeted and retweeted thousands of times by some of the biggest names in professional wrestling.  His photos have been used as the basis of t-shirts sold by wrestlers through prowrestlingtees.com.  His photos have been used for the artwork of PWG and ROH DVDs.
During the main event of Pro Wrestling Guerrilla's eleventh anniversary show, a Guerrilla Warfare match between The Young Bucks and Candice LaRae &
column2: Joey Ryan, photographer Devin Chen's camera was broken--the lens snapped from the camera.  This unfortunate occupational hazard puts Devin out a few thousand dollars and takes away the instrument he would use to make money to replace it.

column1: • Let's help Devin get back to his spot ringside where he gets some of the best photos of independent professional wrestling around.

• Every cent donated through this campaign will go directly to paying for Devin's replacement camera.  If by your generosity, we raise more than we need, the money will go to other supplies that will help Devin get even better shots than he gets now.
• As a thank you for donating to this cause, we have a number of different perks we're offering, ranging from photos, autographed photos, and even the camera broken during the match!

• If we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still go a long way in helping Devin get back to shooting the high quality photos that have made him known as one of the best photographers in independent pro wrestling.
What the money is specifically going towards:
• Canon EOS-5D Mark III Digital SLR Camera Body, 22.3 Megapixel
• Canon EF 17-40mm f/4L USM Ultra Wide Angle Zoom Lens with Case and Lens Hood

• Devin loves sharing his photos with the wrestling community.  He comes to most shows with envelops of photos that he gives out to both fans and wrestlers.  He spends countless hours editing and uploading his photos so people who couldn't attend a particular show can still witness the magic of the event.  He needs our help to keep doing this!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone who sees this doesn't have the money to donate.  That doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are some other ways you can help:

• Tell your friends.  Tweet about it.  Post about it.  Message about it.  Youtube about it.  Instagram about it.  Podcast about it.  Text about it.  Even Snapchat about it!  Let people know about this little campaign we're running to help out not only a pro wrestling photographer, but a fellow pro wrestling fan.

Short Summary If you're a fan of independent professional wrestling, you've seen his photos.  Pro Wrestling Guerrilla.  Ring of Honor.  Evolve.  Dragon Gate USA.  All Pro Wrestling.  Hoodslam.  Big Time Wrestling.  Championship Wrestling from Hollywood.  Gold Rush Pro Wrestling.  He's shot them all.

His photos have been tweeted and retweeted thousands of times by some of the biggest names in professional wrestling.  His photos have been used as the basis of t-shirts sold by wrestlers through prowrestlingtees.com.  His photos have been used for the artwork of PWG and ROH DVDs.

During the main event of Pro Wrestling Guerrilla's eleventh anniversary show, a Guerrilla Warfare match between The Young Bucks and Candice LaRae & Joey Ryan, photographer Devin Chen's camera was broken--the lens snapped from the camera.  This unfortunate occupational hazard puts Devin out a few thousand dollars and takes away the instrument he would use to make money to replace it.
This is where you come in!
Let's help Devin get back to his spot ringside where he gets some of the best photos of independent professional wrestling around.

Every cent donated through this campaign will go directly to paying for Devin's replacement camera.  If by your generosity, we raise more than we need, the money will go to other supplies that will help Devin get even better shots than he gets now.
As a thank you for donating to this cause, we have a number of different perks we're offering, ranging from photos, autographed photos, and even the camera broken during the match!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still go a long way in helping Devin get back to shooting the high quality photos that have made him known as one of the best photographers in independent pro wrestling.
What the money is specifically going towards:
Canon EOS-5D Mark III Digital SLR Camera Body, 22.3 Megapixel
Canon EF 17-40mm f/4L USM Ultra Wide Angle Zoom Lens with Case and Lens Hood

Devin loves sharing his photos with the wrestling community.  He comes to most shows with envelops of photos that he gives out to both fans and wrestlers.  He spends countless hours editing and uploading his photos so people who couldn't attend a particular show can still witness the magic of the event.  He needs our help to keep doing this!
Other Ways You Can Help We know that everyone who sees this doesn't have the money to donate.  That doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are some other ways you can help:

Tell your friends.  Tweet about it.  Post about it.  Message about it.  Youtube about it.  Instagram about it.  Podcast about it.  Text about it.  Even Snapchat about it!  Let people know about this little campaign we're running to help out not only a pro wrestling photographer, but a fellow pro wrestling fan.

column11: >is an innovative product designed for travellers and burden-free photographers. It could be used in any situation or even spots that tripods are forbidden. All you need to mount your compact, mirroless, DSLR  cameras or even instant or rangefinder film cameras, or just your day-to-day gopro or smartphone (with an adapter), is just a rail or simply a flat surface. And you could enjoy a very stable and hassle-free setup for long exposure shots and time-lapse photos. The tiny unibody of MPH is made by elegant yet super lightweight magnesium alloy, which weight only 103g. Just carry around in your pocket to enjoy the beauty of the mini Plastic Hand!

column12:
> 
 

 

 

","miniPlasterHand is an innovative product designed for travellers and burden-free photographers. It could be used in any situation or even spots that tripods are forbidden. All you need to mount your compact, mirroless, DSLR  cameras or even instant or rangefinder film cameras, or just your day-to-day gopro or smartphone (with an adapter), is just a rail or simply a flat surface. And you could enjoy a very stable and hassle-free setup for long exposure shots and time-lapse photos. The tiny unibody of MPH is made by elegant yet super lightweight magnesium alloy, which weight only 103g. Just carry around in your pocket to enjoy the beauty of the mini Plastic Hand!Mission complete!Thank you very much for the support to us! The production of mini Plaster Hands are all completed. Here are some pictures of the beautiful yet elegant mPH: Thank you all media, editer & youtuber!Reviews & Unboxing From Editer and MPH usersVideo Review English: Totally Weird Name, Totally worthwhile Gadget “Mini Plaster Hand”  by Nate ""Blunty"" BurrReview English:  Stuff I bring when I travel by Marc HastenteufelReview Traditional Chines: http://photo.popart.hk/newweb/archives/58953 by FrankieUnboxing Traditional Chinese: http://viewfinder.hk/?p=2690  by AlfredUnboxing Traditional Chinese: http://frankster.digital/  by HamsterTimelapse & Test Videohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JH60uSSGr4ghttps://www.flickr.com/photos/oscaraymc/32106342036/in/pool-3100658@N23/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MjGMasNz2OE&feature=youtu.behttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DtEJMxFXFmcFor more reviews and information, please go to ""miniorenji MPH page""  Flickr Group PhotosPlease enjoy some MPH user sample pics from our flickr group. You are also welcomed to submit your favourite pic by MPH.Flickr group:  https://www.flickr.com/groups/3100658@N23/For more testing shots, please visit: https://www.flickr.com/photos/134232230@N05/ Operating Principalmini Plaster Hand use a special antiskid strap, by wrapping on any horizontal cylindrical surface, it will attach stably, or directly putting on any surface without using strap. There are 3 ways to use mini Plaster Hand, it was designed to be used at any environment anytime conveniently. Mode A Suitable place : Any flat surfaceJust put it on a flat surface and done! This is the quickest way to use mini Plaster Hand! You even do not need to press the strap and let it flatten. Press the back of the plate lightly could enhance stability on rough surface, while you do not need to press if it is already in balance. You could also mount your long lens with a quick plate and a tripod head on it, with making adjustment accordingly. Mode B Suitable place : Any horizontal cylinder (1-4 secounds)Wrap the strap on curved rail and put it through from the front hole to the rear hole, and tighten it. Then place the middle part downward, and put it through the middle part. Lastly, wrap the rest of the strap to the rail and hold it by hand. Set the self-time on camera to 2 sec or more and done! It would be safer to slide the strap obliquely via the hinge, as it is a safety design to prevent any accidental fall of the camera.

column1: Mode C Suitable place : Any horizontal cylinder (5-60 secounds)

Put it on a curved surface and pass the strap through the back. Pull it upward and hold downward to tighten the strap. Put the middle accessory to the bottom and counter weight by a bag or any heavy stuff, and it will be perfectly secured. You can set the exposure time even longer.
1. For brand new MPH, please remove all transparent protecting film carefully.
2. For use with ease, always put the T buckle in the front position. (Please refer to Mode B/C instruction)

3. The strap could be wrapped around MPH and you probably don't need additional bag to retain it. Always put it in your bag and you could apply MPH at anytime and anywhere. Please refer to our official site for more information.
4. For update information, please go to: http://www.miniorenji.com/mini-plaster-hand

Mode A1. Tighten knob on ballhead.2. Put ballhead on MPH.3. Install camera on ball head.4. Set angle as indicated.5. Set self-timer and press the shutter!  Mode B1. Tighten the ballhead.2. Put the ballhead on MPH.3. Put the T-BUCKLE near the MPH BODY. (Important!)4. Release ballhead and put on the camera.5. Place the MPH and adjust the location.6. Pass HOOK BUCKLE through MPH BODY, wrap around on rail and put back through T-BUCKLE.7. Wrap the rest of the strap on cylinder and tighten it.8. Hold the HOOK BACKLE on the rail with hand and you could take a few secounds exposure shot.

1. Tighten the ballhead.2. Put the ballhead on MPH.3. Put the T-BUCKLE near the MPH BODY. (Important!)4. Place the MPH on rail.5. HOOK BUCKLE through the MPH BODY around the rail, then through the T-BUCKLE.6. Put your bag or heavy objects on the HOOK BUCKLE.7. Release ballhead and put on the camera.8. Set the angle, set self timer to 2 secounds or more.Tips: Mount mPH nearby a vertical rail enhance the stability.  Cylinder shape and materialAnti-slippery side of strapping in mini Plaster Hand is made by a very stable and specialised material. It could be used on many type of surfaces with anti-slippery function. It is also very durable and our test results are as following.
This is a simple but useful safety design. If you put it straight right through the hinge, you could not pull in or out of it, unless you put it through the hinge obliquely.
If you want to get more information of application and setup methods,
please go to Online Introduction & Instructions at:
We will also ""post"" updates here and you are welcomed to check it out!

For this product, we’ve created a brand“miniorenji”, we hope to publish our new products (if any) in future under this brand name. Why“orenji”? It means orange, small yet tasty and lovely, we want to have all our designed products just like the mini-orengi, tiny but useful. Also,“mPH”designer  named this product as“mini Plaster Hand”, because we always see there’s a saying on some photography forums, “You can’t shoot a good photo at night, unless you gear with a pair of plaster hands”.

From inspiration, design, sourcing components, producing prototype, to making agreement of small production amount with the manufacturer, it takes a lot of time and effort. Your funds will be used on purchasing high quality material, packing, manufacturing and transportation. With your support, not only the production will come true, more product that convenient everyone daily live could be produced. Thank you for reading this project, and thank you for your support.   www.miniorenji.com",12.0,0,"1 Campaign
Photography is my greatest joy, my contemplation, my
expression. I’m out photographing every day.
I used to have a wonderful camera, but after more than ten
years of constant use, it died about 2 years ago - All the photos you’ve seen
over the past few years have been taken just on my iPhone. I sadly can’t afford

a new camera on one nonprofit salary - So I’m hoping you can help me.

Photography <
What I most like about photography is its ability to help
the viewer appreciate an aspect of the world that we are usually too busy to
notice. My pictures try to hold pieces of the beautiful world up to your eyes for
you to wonder at. I love the medium of the camera and lens, with their ability
to focus and distort what we see in order to bring to our eyes aspects of the
view that we couldn't see unaided. And of course, the storytelling of images, the

Why do I need a camera? 

I could create the beautiful images that reside in my imagination, rather than struggling with the limits of a phone. With a real camera, I can tell the stories I see, return to
serious photography, express my artistic vision, exhibit my work, produce
gigantic, high-quality prints, learn portraiture and other new skills, maybe
even publish a book of my photography. These are all real opportunities that I’ve

had to turn down over the past year because I didn’t have the equipment. With a camera, I can say yes to art.

What will the money buy?

The camera that could serve my needs costs a LOT of money. (For you camera nerds - Canon EOS 5D Mark III) With all the lenses and filters and other accouterments, it'll actually cost more than the $5K I’m trying to raise here – I’m chipping in all I can
spare myself for this. If I raise less than my goal, I'll buy a similar but
less sophisticated model (Mark II). If I raise more, I'll get nicer lenses, and filters, lights, reflective umbrellas...!
to spend this much money on my own art, and I know there are many worthy things

you can put your money towards, but I’ll promise to use this camera to share beauty and tell important stories. (And it would bring me such great joy!)

I can't do this alone
I truly can’t do this without you. I'm grateful that I can cover my basic needs, but I don't make enough to save up for this kind of expense. Please chip in any amount
today, and you’ll get all kinds of expressions of my gratitude!
Thank you for helping make my vision a reality!

My name is Sam Masoni, currently working as a field guide/ranger on a small privately owned game reserve. I'm 23 years old and have a strong passion for wildlife and educating and showing people the animals I get to work with there is a great opportunity for me to enhance my photography here as we also do wildlife/safari weddings and photoshoots. Photography has always been a passion of mine starting from school days, taking photography class and getting to use the schools camera. I fell in love with photography right away. Now having the chance to capture the true beauty of these wild animal and being able to sow the work it is a dream come true.

I would like to start printing and creating post cards with my pictures to show the world our animal in an area where there is NO hunting. Seeing the calmness in the animals eyes is a true capture. My camera lens has broken and therefor I cannot take anymore pictures. I would love to start shooting again and taking 1000's of photos again.

Any donations will allow me to get my lens fixed(if possible) or allow me to get the right equipment for wildlife photography and the equipment for editing for printing after capturing. I have repaired my lens before and having photography as a hobby it is as everyone knows its an expensive hobby, thus I want to start doing something with my photography skills and passion.

All funds raised will go straight into photography gear, even if short of my goal. I want to buy a new camera with lenses and even try to join another photography class on wildlife photography to better my skills. Brand new gear is always better than second hand used gear as you never know if used gear will break 2 months after having it. Perks, shipment is expensive although once i'm back to capturing the beauty of these wild animals I will send my best shots on a personalized postcard.
Gear I need - A new Camera (Canon or Nikon), wide lenses, short lenses and 200-300mm lenses and the long lens 600/800mm. Along with a protective camera bag to fit all lenses

I can not start this phase of my photography without the help of anyone who is willing to contribute towards this campaign to help me start back up. If i don't have any contribution to help me start I will have to keep trying to win competitions in magazines and online, however everyone that enters has amazing equipment already. This is  my chance to get my pictures out there.
I know there are many people who can not contribute with funds but everyone knows someone who knows someone out there that might be able to help me. Please share my campaign to everyone you know.

My name is Sam Masoni, currently working as a field guide/ranger on a small privately owned game reserve. I'm 23 years old and have a strong passion for wildlife and educating and showing people the animals I get to work with there is a great opportunity for me to enhance my photography here as we also do wildlife/safari weddings and photoshoots. Photography has always been a passion of mine starting from school days, taking photography class and getting to use the schools camera. I fell in love with photography right away. Now having the chance to capture the true beauty of these wild animal and being able to sow the work it is a dream come true.

I would like to start printing and creating post cards with my pictures to show the world our animal in an area where there is NO hunting. Seeing the calmness in the animals eyes is a true capture. My camera lens has broken and therefor I cannot take anymore pictures. I would love to start shooting again and taking 1000's of photos again.

Any donations will allow me to get my lens fixed(if possible) or allow me to get the right equipment for wildlife photography and the equipment for editing for printing after capturing. I have repaired my lens before and having photography as a hobby it is as everyone knows its an expensive hobby, thus I want to start doing something with my photography skills and passion.

All funds raised will go straight into photography gear, even if short of my goal. I want to buy a new camera with lenses and even try to join another photography class on wildlife photography to better my skills. Brand new gear is always better than second hand used gear as you never know if used gear will break 2 months after having it. Perks, shipment is expensive although once i'm back to capturing the beauty of these wild animals I will send my best shots on a personalized postcard.

Keep Camera Batteries Powered Up with the Smart, Portable 7-in-1 XTAR SN4 Charging Hub 

As an avid photographer or videographer it is not uncommon to have multiple cameras and devices on hand at any given time
column2:
each that requires their own battery charger and exclusive battery pack. But taking all those with you means lugging around a bunch of extra bags for space or constantly having to swap out batteries or connections to get them each charged up on a single port. That’s why we developed the innovative and versatile XTAR SN4 Battery Charging Hub that lets you charge multiple batteries and battery types simultaneously at home or on the go, so you never have to worry about missing a great shot or capturing a beautiful video because of a dead battery.

    

 

 

 

 

The CHARGER that will change your LIFE!

The best allround charger!

column1: The Fastest QUAD charger for your camera! The XTAR SN4!
Too many chargers, too many cables, not portable....a MESS. Let's end that! XTAR have done the SN4 - a versatile, simple, modular, powerful charging system. Good deal.

column3:
showinfo=0"">
 

Amazing Camera Battery Charger The XTAR SN4 is a game changer!

column1: A multi charger for every camera battery!
XTAR SN4 Multi-Camera Battery Charger | EOS R6

An all-in-one charging hub for cameras and other device batteries, this modular charging dock helps you quickly adapt to photography and videography shoots on the fly by keeping your batteries powered up together.

 

 

The smarter, more adaptive design of our charging hub means you can easily clip in a charging plate to charge a battery or unclip it for storage in seconds. No wasted time!

 

 

 

Able to support max 3A charging speeds single slot this lithium battery charger offers quick charge capabilities that’s 4x faster than standard hubs or cables and automatically adjusts to the needs of your battery.  

 

 

Unlike other chargers which still use pulse charging technology that fluctuates electrical currents going into the battery, we use a three-stage intelligent charging protocol, which greatly reduces battery wear and improves battery life expectancy.

 

SN4 can charge many battery models of camera and photographic instrument. It will match best charging current according these criteria: the input power of the charging adapter, the number of batteries being charged, the internal resistance of battery and battery type.This strategy will allow SN4 to adopt the most efficient and safest recharge possible.

 

 

The XTAR SN4 can be set up in multiple configurations that support two or four slots depending on your charging needs. Great for beginners and professional photographers.

 

 

 

A versatile design, our battery charger currently supports 9 different battery models. You can mix and match batteries from Canon, Nikon, and Sony. We have future plans to support GoPro, Panasonic, Fujifilm, Olympus and more. 

 

 

The XTAR SN4 battery charger can support up to seven unique charging plates for different battery types. Better yet, it can hook them up all together at the same time in a smart, adaptive power daisy chain that ensures each one gets maximum power efficiency without overheating or overcharging.   

 

The Dock Model's name is the same as the Battery Model's name. 

 

 *Note: Dock Model=Battery Model.

 

 

 

More than anything, this ion battery charger helps you do away with packing up and unrolling tons of different cords as a photographer or videographer, so you can save room in your backpack, camera bag, or travel pack.

 

 

This 7-in-1 adaptive charging hub measures in at just 61.7*52.7*23.2 mm, which means it’s easy to keep in a backpack, camera bag, travel pack, or with other camera equipment.

 

 

 

The XTAR SN4 portable battery charger utilizes a simple, yet effective Type-C charging cable which makes a convenient camera battery charger you can plug into your car, laptop, power bank, power station or standard wall adapter.

 

 

 

 

 *Note 

Each adapter will be attached with only one plug according to different country.  

 

 

What is the maximum capacity of XTAR storage bag ?

1*SN4 charger, 1* Adapter, 4* Docks, 6* Batteries and More !！

 

 

 

F970 Dock 

*Please noted as a matching gift for XTAR launching its first project on Kickstarter, the dock for battery Sony F970 is a part of all SN4 Kits. And you can order more docks via Add-ons or a post-campaign survey after campaign ends.

 

*Note of ""Other Charging Docks""

You can select docks that SN4 supported (which listed in Add-ons: other charger docks) . 

 

*Important: 

a.All the prices above are before taxes and not including the cost of shipping. 

b.The shipping fee of EU orders are include cost of shipping+VAT tax !!
column2:
>How to Pledge

 

 

The Only Camera Charger You Need | XTAR SN4 !
column4:
showinfo=0"">
 

One Charger for All my Camera Batteries!

column1: XTAR SN4 Fast Charges up to 4 Camera Batteries
XTAR SN4 Multi Camera Battery PD Fast Charger Indiegogo Campaign Today I Feel Like TIFL

FAQ 

1.How to Pledge your SN4 Charger ?

Step 1 : Check your Camera brand and model , find the serial# of Charger-dock 

Step 2 : Choose a reward

Step 3:  Process the payment, then select specific charger-dock models of sets

2.Does it include local tax?

The tax is included within The United States, and you will need to pay taxes according to your local tariff policy in other regions. 

3.When will my SN4 charger be delivered?

The first batch of SN4 chargers will be shipped in August.

4.Warranty Period?

XTAR provides a 2-year warranty globally for SN4 charger (adapter and other spare parts excluded).

5. Do you supply batteries too?

Yeah, you can order them from add-ons.

6. Can SN4 activate the over-discharged camera batteries like other XTAR chargers do? 

Sure, SN4 can definitely bring your over-discharged batteries back to life.

7. What are the SN4 advantages of three-stage charging compared with traditional methods?

Unlike other chargers which still uses pulse charging technology that fluctuates electrical currents going into the battery, we use a three-stage intelligent charging protocol, which greatly reduces battery wear and improves battery life expectancy.

8. Why some camera batteries cannot be charged at current 3A/2A?

Because some batteries are of larger internal resistance than others.  To ensure the safety while charging, these battery manufacturers restrict the input current to 1.6A~1.9A max. SN4 can automatically identify battery type and internal resistance and adopt optimal current. For batteries of large internal resistance( small capacity, used and low quality batteries), SN4 will automatically decrease the charging current to prevent batteries from overheating, and ensure the safety of users.

9. How do you make SN4 the fastest camera battery charger in the world?

Firstly, the fastest was what we have aimed for since day one. We designed it to support a higher power and bigger charging current. Secondly, all our specifications are real, you will get what you see here. XTAR has been focusing on lithium battery charging technology for 15 years and has many patents for these advance technologies.  We have had major breakthrough in tackling the problems of slow charging, insufficient charging, charging damage to the battery, unsafe charging, and mixed charging of different brands of batteries at the same time. We're focused, and more professional. 

10.Do all SN4 Kits include the charging dock for battery Sony F970 ? How can i order more docks for other batteries?

Yes. As a matching gift when XTAR launching first project on Kickstarter, the dock for battery Sony F970 is a part of all SN4 Kits. And you can order more docks via Add-ons or a post-campaign survey after campaign ends.

Projekts „Und der Name des Sterns heißt Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl“
Alexander Kaschte, 36 Jahre alt, Autor, Musiker und freier Fotograf aus
Marburg an der Lahn. Ich interessiere mich seit längerem für die
menschlichen Aspekte der Tschernobyl-Katastrophe. Meine Erinnerungen an
den Reaktorunfall, dessen Auswirkungen ich als Kind kurz vor Ende des
Kalten Krieges und vor dem Hintergrund der revitalisierten
Anti-Atomkraftbewegung in Deutschland miterlebt habe, sind nie verblasst.
Fukushima ereignete sich wenige Wochen, nachdem meine Tochter in Moskau
geboren wurde – der Unfall in Japan hat Tschernobyl wieder verstärkt in das
Zentrum meiner Wahrnehmung und künstlerischen Arbeit gerückt. Ich
engagiere mich seitdem ehrenamtlich in einem Verein, der Kindern aus von
der Reaktorkatastrophe betroffenen Familien Erholungsaufenthalte in
Deutschland ermöglicht. Ich habe in den vergangenen zwei Jahren mehrmals
die Ukraine bereist und dabei Menschen und Schicksale kennengelernt, von
denen ich in Wort und Bild erzählen und berichten möchte. Durch meine
Vereinsarbeit konnte ich vor Ort ein zuverlässiges Netzwerk aus Freunden,
meiner Kampagne ist die Veröffentlichung einer Fotodokumentation, die sich
jenen Menschen widmet, die auch heute noch unmittelbar von Tschernobyl
betroffen sind. Das gesammelte Material soll der Öffentlichkeit in
Buchform, als Ausstellung und in Vorträgen zugänglich gemacht werden. Es
geht mir bei meiner Arbeit weniger um den Reaktor und die von Extremtouristen
und Sensationsfotografen tausendfach fotografierte Geisterstadt Prypjat,
obwohl auch meine Dokumentation nicht ohne Fotos dieser Art auskommen
wird. Im Vordergrund haben aber die Menschen zu stehen, die aus Prypjat
evakuiert wurden, die Rückkehrerinnen, die ihren Lebensabend bewusst auf
kontaminiertem Boden in der Sperrzone verbringen, alle, die zum Zeitpunkt
der Katastrophe Kinder waren und heute selbst Kinder haben. Auch hoffe
ich, durch diese Kampagne mein Netzwerk weiter ausbauen und Verbindungen
knüpfen zu können, die später in der Gründung eines eigenen Vereins münden
sollen. Das Ziel dieses Vereins wird es sein, Kinder aus den Zonen 2 und 3
der Tschernobyl-Region langfristig in Belangen ihrer schulischen Bildung
zu begleitet, ihnen ein Studium zu ermöglichen und den Austausch mit
europäischen Universitäten zu organisieren. Der Verein soll mit seiner
Arbeit da ansetzen, wo die Arbeit Erholungsurlaube ermöglichender Vereine
mich bei dieser Kampagne unterstützt, hilft bei der Realisierung eines
sehr persönlichen und zutiefst menschlichen Projektes, das nicht nur für
mich von großer Bedeutung ist. Ich erinnere mich genau an die Unsicherheit
meiner Eltern, als Kinder im Mai 1986 nicht im Regen spielen und auch
nicht durch Pfützen laufen durften - als im Sommer das Pflücken von
Löwenzahn verboten war, niemand wusste, ob man Kuhmilch noch trinken kann
und das Gemüse im Garten größer wuchs als je zuvor. Als Vater eines Kindes
und als Mensch, der die schrecklichen Folgen des weltweit schwersten
Unfalls in einem Kernkraftwerk mehrfach mit eigenen Augen gesehen hat, kann
ich nicht verstehen, wie man Atomkraft noch positiv bewerten kann. Mit
meiner Kampagne möchte ich zu einer weiteren Sensibilisierung bezüglich
des Themenkomplexes beitragen und die Erinnerung am Leben erhalten: Fast
30 Jahre nach der Havarie gerät Tschernobyl weiter in Vergessenheit,
obwohl Menschen immer noch an den Folgen des Unfalls sterben.
Sterns heißt Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl“ sind mehrere
längere Reisen in die Ukraine geplant. Ich beabsichtige, nicht nur mit den
von der Tschernobyl-Katastrophe betroffenen Menschen zu sprechen und sie
zu fotografieren, ich möchte, um Ergebnisse von höchster Authentizität zu
erzielen, über einen Zeitraum von mehreren Wochen am Leben dieser Menschen
teilhaben und sie in ihrem Alltag begleiten.
den Reisekosten entstehen auch Kosten für Unterkunft, für erforderliche
Dokumente sowie für ortskundige Fahrer und Übersetzer. Ich bin des
Russischen zwar insoweit mächtig, dass ich mich einigermaßen verständigen

column2: da ich aber auch die leisen Töne und feinen Nuancen

column1: zwischen den Zeilen meiner Gesprächs- und Interviewpartner einfangen
möchte, ist professionelle Hilfe unerlässlich. Sämtliche Gespräche werden
aufgezeichnet, verschriftlicht und anschließend präzise übersetzt.
Vergessen darf man auch nicht die am Ende entstehenden Satzkosten – aus
meinen Fotos und Texten soll nicht nur ein berührendes und
eindrucksvolles, sondern auch ein optisch ansprechendes Buch entstehen.
hinaus wird nicht nur Geld für Dienstleistungen benötigt: Meine
Kameraausrüstung muss für dieses Projekt um einige Komponenten erweitert
und aufgewertet werden, und so klischeehaft es auch klingen mag: Ich
brauche auf Reisen einen eigenen, zuverlässigen Geigerzähler und eine
Extraportion Pralinen und Wodka, die mir Türen zu Orten öffnet, an die man
nur mit Pralinen und Wodka gelangt. Schlussendlich will ich die Familien
und Kinder in den Zonen 2 und 3 auch nicht mit leeren Händen besuchen –
Schokolade bringe ich nie mit, wohl aber Schreibhefte und Dinge, die in
den Dörfern nicht erhältlich sind (z.B. Webcams).
einer eine Reise tut, dann kann er was erzählen: Es ist mir ein Anliegen,
anderen Menschen von meinen Erlebnissen zu berichten, meine Erfahrungen zu
teilen und meine Eindrücke zu schildern. Ob dies mittels meiner
Info-Dossiers, im kleinen Rahmen zuhause mit Laptop und Beamer oder im
Kontext eines Vortrags vor größerem Publikum passiert, macht für mich
keinen Unterschied. Ich möchte vor allem eines: Menschen erreichen. Wie
der Text zu dieser Kampagne eindrucksvoll demonstriert, ist das Thema sehr
umfangreich – umfangreich soll auch das Buch werden, für das ich mit
250-300 Seiten und einem Format von mindestens 30cm x 30cm rechne und das
ich von meiner „Kampagne“ oder meinem „Projekt“ spreche, meine ich damit
mehrere Einzelkampagnen, die ich ca. einen Monat vor den anstehenden
Reisen starten werde – die aktuell laufende Kampagne unterstützt immer
meinen nächsten Aufenthalt in der Ukraine. Ich werde mindestens dreimal,
wahrscheinlich aber fünfmal vor Ort sein. Auf diese Weise möchte ich
Vertrauen schaffen und meinen Unterstützern und Unterstützerinnen die
Möglichkeit geben, mich auf die Probe zu stellen: Sie können sich erst
mittels der Info-Dossiers von der Qualität meiner Fotos und Texte
überzeugen, bevor sie sich dazu entscheiden, mich durch den Kauf eines
anderen Perks oder den Erwerb des Buches zu unterstützen.
meine Kampagne nicht das gesteckte Ziel erreichen, werde ich das Projekt
trotzdem realisieren und irgendwie aus eigenen Mitteln zu finanzieren
versuchen. Ich bin von seiner Wichtigkeit überzeugt und weiß um die Dinge,
die ich in der Ukraine gesehen und die Erfahrungen, die ich dort gemacht
habe. Für mich, der aufgrund familiärer Strukturen wie ein Pendel zwischen
dem westlichen und östlichen Kulturkreis hin und her schwingt, gehört das
Thema zum Alltag – und es ließ mich nie teilnahmslos zurück. Sollte eine
meiner Kampagnen über das gesteckte Ziel hinausschießen, werde ich das
überschüssige Geld für die nächsten Reisen zurücklegen und das Projekt um
weitere Aufnahmeverfahren sowie um das Medium „Film“ erweitern.
Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl"" so wichtig ist
ist ein riskantes Spiel mit dem Feuer, ein Spiel mit dem Tod – dieses
Spiel kann man nur verlieren. Die Menschen, die nach der Explosion von
Reaktor 4 als erste vor Ort waren und dabei geholfen haben, das Feuer zu
löschen oder Trümmer zu beseitigen, sind größtenteils innerhalb von 72
Stunden gestorben. Wenn man die Sperrzone heute, fast 30 Jahren nach dem
Unfall, bereist, darf man in ihr nicht rauchen, nicht essen und nicht
trinken – die Gefahr der Aufnahme radioaktiver Partikel ist zu groß. Man darf
sich nirgendwo hinsetzen, Taschen nicht auf dem Boden abstellen und muss
vermeiden, mit Staub in Berührung zu kommen, der im Sommer von
vorbeifahrenden Fahrzeugen oder dem Wind aufgewirbelt wird und von
Türrahmen rieseln könnte. Die Rückkehrerinnen in der als für immer
unbewohnbar geltenden Sperrzone sowie die Familien in den Dörfern der Zonen
2 und 3 sind Selbstversorger – sie ernähren sich von Obst und Gemüse, das
auf kontaminiertem Boden wächst, von Tieren, die verseuchtes Futter
fressen, von ihrer Milch, ihrem Fleisch und ihren Eiern. Es werden
auffällig viele behinderte Kinder geboren, unter Jugendlichen ist
Schilddrüsenkrebs weit verbreitet, die Anzahl der Krebserkrankungen unter
Erwachsenen ist enorm. Um zu verstehen, das dort vor sich geht, und zu
erahnen, wie es ist, dort zu leben, muss man es gesehen haben.
mag zwar nach Fukushima der Kernenergie den Rücken gekehrt haben, ist aber
von Ländern umgeben, in denen es auch weiterhin Atomkraftwerke gibt. Die
Frage nach dem Umgang mit ihren Abfällen, deren Transport und ihrer
Endlagerung kann nur lückenhaft beantwortet werden. In einigen Regionen
des 1986 bundesweit vom radioaktiven Fallout Tschernobyls am schlimmsten
betroffenen Freistaates Bayern sind Pilze und Wildschweine noch immer radioaktiv.
Es ist unvorstellbar, was mit uns geschehen würde, wenn sich in einem
unserer Nachbarländer ein atomarer Unfall ereignete – doch auch in
Tschernobyl, das weniger als 2.000 Kilometer von Frankfurt am Main
entfernt liegt, ist mit dem sich seit 2012 im Bau befindlichen neuen
Sarkophag die Gefahr nicht gebannt. Durch Projekte wie dieses werden die
Folgen des weltweit schwersten Unfalls in einem Kernkraftwerk 30 Jahre
später veranschaulicht und erlebbar, spürbar und nachvollziehbar gemacht.

Menschlich und aus nächster Nähe.



Risiken &
Osten der Ukraine herrscht Krieg. Von diesem Krieg bekommt man in Kiew und
im Westen des Landes nur sehr wenig zu spüren, das Leben verläuft nach den
Ausschreitungen auf dem Maidan wieder in einigermaßen geordneten Bahnen.
Trotzdem weiß niemand, was morgen passiert – die Menschen sind vorsichtig
und unsicher geworden, sie wollen sich auf nichts festlegen, keine
Verbindlichkeiten eingehen. Es ist schwer geworden, Pläne zu schmieden,
Termine zu machen oder Sicherheit und Zuverlässigkeit zu verlangen. Die
meisten meiner Kontakte wollen erst wenige Tage vor anvisierten Treffen
angeschrieben oder angerufen werden, was mir ein Höchstmaß an Flexibilität
Menschen in der Ukraine sind sehr gastfreundlich – und stellen einem Gast
in der Regel alles auf den Tisch, was sie im Haus haben und anbieten
können. Verständlich, dass es einer Beleidigung gleichkommt, wenn man ihre
Gastfreundschaft ablehnt. Wie ich mich verhalten werde, wenn man mir in
der Sperrzone oder in den Zonen 2 und 3 angebautes Obst und Gemüse oder
selbst gebrannten Wodka anbietet, weiß ich nicht. Auch bedarf die
Beantwortung der Frage danach, wie ich mich ernähre, wenn ich mich für
längere Zeit in den verseuchten Gebieten aufhalte, sowohl sorgfältiger
Planung als auch einer gewissen Risikobereitschaft. Ich denke, dass ich
mich für eine Mischung aus Vorsicht, faulen Ausreden und journalistischem
Wahnsinn entscheiden werde – in täglich unterschiedlichen Mischverhältnissen.
der Tag des GAUs von Tschernobyl am 26.04.2016 zum 30. Mal jährt, ist mit
fotografischen und journalistischen Mitbewerbern zu rechnen – schon jetzt
sind im Internet diverse Fotografen vertreten, die marktschreierisch und
mit immer extremeren Fotos ihre Tschernobyl-Projekte anpreisen. Ich freue
mich deshalb über den Sonderstatus und den zutiefst menschlichen
Blickwinkel, den mein Projekt einnimmt, denn er grenzt meine Arbeit
deutlich von der Arbeit anderer ab. In die Ukraine fliegen, Dollarscheine auf
den Tisch legen, einen kontaminierten, leerstehenden Plattenbau fotografieren
und am Computer den Kontrast erhöhen – das kann jeder. Die Bereitschaft,
sich menschlichen Tragödien zu stellen, sich in die Erzählenden hinein zu fühlen
und sie im richtigen Augenblick abzulichten, bringen nur wenige mit. Viele
suchen die Sensation und nicht den Menschen, sie zeigen kein wirkliches
Interesse an ihren Gesprächspartnern. Ich bringe die für dieses Projekt

notwendige Bereitschaft, das Interesse und fotografische Leidenschaft mit.



Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
man meinem Projekt nicht finanziell helfen, kann man es trotzdem anders
unterstützen: Bitte hilf mir dabei, diese Kampagne bekannt zu machen. Erzähle
von ihr in deiner Familie, bei deinen Freunden, auf der Arbeit, im
Schulunterricht. Teile sie auf Facebook, damit möglichst viele Menschen
von dem Projekt und der Thematik erfahren. Du kannst dafür das Tool von

Indiegogo nutzen!

Alle im Kontext dieser Kampagne präsentierten Fotos: (c) Alexander Kaschte. 

Falls Fragen zum den Bildern bestehen: Schreib mir einfach!
Projekts „Und der Name des Sterns heißt Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl“
Alexander Kaschte, 36 Jahre alt, Autor, Musiker und freier Fotograf aus
Marburg an der Lahn. Ich interessiere mich seit längerem für die
menschlichen Aspekte der Tschernobyl-Katastrophe. Meine Erinnerungen an
den Reaktorunfall, dessen Auswirkungen ich als Kind kurz vor Ende des
Kalten Krieges und vor dem Hintergrund der revitalisierten
Anti-Atomkraftbewegung in Deutschland miterlebt habe, sind nie verblasst.
Fukushima ereignete sich wenige Wochen, nachdem meine Tochter in Moskau
geboren wurde – der Unfall in Japan hat Tschernobyl wieder verstärkt in das
Zentrum meiner Wahrnehmung und künstlerischen Arbeit gerückt. Ich
engagiere mich seitdem ehrenamtlich in einem Verein, der Kindern aus von
der Reaktorkatastrophe betroffenen Familien Erholungsaufenthalte in
Deutschland ermöglicht. Ich habe in den vergangenen zwei Jahren mehrmals
die Ukraine bereist und dabei Menschen und Schicksale kennengelernt, von
denen ich in Wort und Bild erzählen und berichten möchte. Durch meine
Vereinsarbeit konnte ich vor Ort ein zuverlässiges Netzwerk aus Freunden,
meiner Kampagne ist die Veröffentlichung einer Fotodokumentation, die sich
jenen Menschen widmet, die auch heute noch unmittelbar von Tschernobyl
betroffen sind. Das gesammelte Material soll der Öffentlichkeit in
Buchform, als Ausstellung und in Vorträgen zugänglich gemacht werden. Es
geht mir bei meiner Arbeit weniger um den Reaktor und die von Extremtouristen
und Sensationsfotografen tausendfach fotografierte Geisterstadt Prypjat,
obwohl auch meine Dokumentation nicht ohne Fotos dieser Art auskommen
wird. Im Vordergrund haben aber die Menschen zu stehen, die aus Prypjat
evakuiert wurden, die Rückkehrerinnen, die ihren Lebensabend bewusst auf
kontaminiertem Boden in der Sperrzone verbringen, alle, die zum Zeitpunkt
der Katastrophe Kinder waren und heute selbst Kinder haben. Auch hoffe
ich, durch diese Kampagne mein Netzwerk weiter ausbauen und Verbindungen
knüpfen zu können, die später in der Gründung eines eigenen Vereins münden
sollen. Das Ziel dieses Vereins wird es sein, Kinder aus den Zonen 2 und 3
der Tschernobyl-Region langfristig in Belangen ihrer schulischen Bildung
zu begleitet, ihnen ein Studium zu ermöglichen und den Austausch mit
europäischen Universitäten zu organisieren. Der Verein soll mit seiner
Arbeit da ansetzen, wo die Arbeit Erholungsurlaube ermöglichender Vereine
mich bei dieser Kampagne unterstützt, hilft bei der Realisierung eines
sehr persönlichen und zutiefst menschlichen Projektes, das nicht nur für
mich von großer Bedeutung ist. Ich erinnere mich genau an die Unsicherheit
meiner Eltern, als Kinder im Mai 1986 nicht im Regen spielen und auch
nicht durch Pfützen laufen durften - als im Sommer das Pflücken von
Löwenzahn verboten war, niemand wusste, ob man Kuhmilch noch trinken kann
und das Gemüse im Garten größer wuchs als je zuvor. Als Vater eines Kindes
und als Mensch, der die schrecklichen Folgen des weltweit schwersten
Unfalls in einem Kernkraftwerk mehrfach mit eigenen Augen gesehen hat, kann
ich nicht verstehen, wie man Atomkraft noch positiv bewerten kann. Mit
meiner Kampagne möchte ich zu einer weiteren Sensibilisierung bezüglich
des Themenkomplexes beitragen und die Erinnerung am Leben erhalten: Fast
30 Jahre nach der Havarie gerät Tschernobyl weiter in Vergessenheit,
obwohl Menschen immer noch an den Folgen des Unfalls sterben.
Was man mir gibt & was man dafür
Sterns heißt Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl“ sind mehrere
längere Reisen in die Ukraine geplant. Ich beabsichtige, nicht nur mit den
von der Tschernobyl-Katastrophe betroffenen Menschen zu sprechen und sie
zu fotografieren, ich möchte, um Ergebnisse von höchster Authentizität zu
erzielen, über einen Zeitraum von mehreren Wochen am Leben dieser Menschen
teilhaben und sie in ihrem Alltag begleiten.
den Reisekosten entstehen auch Kosten für Unterkunft, für erforderliche
Dokumente sowie für ortskundige Fahrer und Übersetzer. Ich bin des
Russischen zwar insoweit mächtig, dass ich mich einigermaßen verständigen

column2: da ich aber auch die leisen Töne und feinen Nuancen

column1: zwischen den Zeilen meiner Gesprächs- und Interviewpartner einfangen
möchte, ist professionelle Hilfe unerlässlich. Sämtliche Gespräche werden
aufgezeichnet, verschriftlicht und anschließend präzise übersetzt.
Vergessen darf man auch nicht die am Ende entstehenden Satzkosten – aus
meinen Fotos und Texten soll nicht nur ein berührendes und
eindrucksvolles, sondern auch ein optisch ansprechendes Buch entstehen.
hinaus wird nicht nur Geld für Dienstleistungen benötigt: Meine
Kameraausrüstung muss für dieses Projekt um einige Komponenten erweitert
und aufgewertet werden, und so klischeehaft es auch klingen mag: Ich
brauche auf Reisen einen eigenen, zuverlässigen Geigerzähler und eine
Extraportion Pralinen und Wodka, die mir Türen zu Orten öffnet, an die man
nur mit Pralinen und Wodka gelangt. Schlussendlich will ich die Familien
und Kinder in den Zonen 2 und 3 auch nicht mit leeren Händen besuchen –
Schokolade bringe ich nie mit, wohl aber Schreibhefte und Dinge, die in
den Dörfern nicht erhältlich sind (z.B. Webcams).
einer eine Reise tut, dann kann er was erzählen: Es ist mir ein Anliegen,
anderen Menschen von meinen Erlebnissen zu berichten, meine Erfahrungen zu
teilen und meine Eindrücke zu schildern. Ob dies mittels meiner
Info-Dossiers, im kleinen Rahmen zuhause mit Laptop und Beamer oder im
Kontext eines Vortrags vor größerem Publikum passiert, macht für mich
keinen Unterschied. Ich möchte vor allem eines: Menschen erreichen. Wie
der Text zu dieser Kampagne eindrucksvoll demonstriert, ist das Thema sehr
umfangreich – umfangreich soll auch das Buch werden, für das ich mit
250-300 Seiten und einem Format von mindestens 30cm x 30cm rechne und das
ich von meiner „Kampagne“ oder meinem „Projekt“ spreche, meine ich damit
mehrere Einzelkampagnen, die ich ca. einen Monat vor den anstehenden
Reisen starten werde – die aktuell laufende Kampagne unterstützt immer
meinen nächsten Aufenthalt in der Ukraine. Ich werde mindestens dreimal,
wahrscheinlich aber fünfmal vor Ort sein. Auf diese Weise möchte ich
Vertrauen schaffen und meinen Unterstützern und Unterstützerinnen die
Möglichkeit geben, mich auf die Probe zu stellen: Sie können sich erst
mittels der Info-Dossiers von der Qualität meiner Fotos und Texte
überzeugen, bevor sie sich dazu entscheiden, mich durch den Kauf eines
anderen Perks oder den Erwerb des Buches zu unterstützen.
meine Kampagne nicht das gesteckte Ziel erreichen, werde ich das Projekt
trotzdem realisieren und irgendwie aus eigenen Mitteln zu finanzieren
versuchen. Ich bin von seiner Wichtigkeit überzeugt und weiß um die Dinge,
die ich in der Ukraine gesehen und die Erfahrungen, die ich dort gemacht
habe. Für mich, der aufgrund familiärer Strukturen wie ein Pendel zwischen
dem westlichen und östlichen Kulturkreis hin und her schwingt, gehört das
Thema zum Alltag – und es ließ mich nie teilnahmslos zurück. Sollte eine
meiner Kampagnen über das gesteckte Ziel hinausschießen, werde ich das
überschüssige Geld für die nächsten Reisen zurücklegen und das Projekt um
weitere Aufnahmeverfahren sowie um das Medium „Film“ erweitern.
Warum „Und der Name des Sterns heißt
Demut – Nahaufnahmen aus Tschernobyl"" so wichtig ist
ist ein riskantes Spiel mit dem Feuer, ein Spiel mit dem Tod – dieses
Spiel kann man nur verlieren. Die Menschen, die nach der Explosion von
Reaktor 4 als erste vor Ort waren und dabei geholfen haben, das Feuer zu
löschen oder Trümmer zu beseitigen, sind größtenteils innerhalb von 72
Stunden gestorben. Wenn man die Sperrzone heute, fast 30 Jahren nach dem
Unfall, bereist, darf man in ihr nicht rauchen, nicht essen und nicht
trinken – die Gefahr der Aufnahme radioaktiver Partikel ist zu groß. Man darf
sich nirgendwo hinsetzen, Taschen nicht auf dem Boden abstellen und muss
vermeiden, mit Staub in Berührung zu kommen, der im Sommer von
vorbeifahrenden Fahrzeugen oder dem Wind aufgewirbelt wird und von
Türrahmen rieseln könnte. Die Rückkehrerinnen in der als für immer
unbewohnbar geltenden Sperrzone sowie die Familien in den Dörfern der Zonen
2 und 3 sind Selbstversorger – sie ernähren sich von Obst und Gemüse, das
auf kontaminiertem Boden wächst, von Tieren, die verseuchtes Futter
fressen, von ihrer Milch, ihrem Fleisch und ihren Eiern. Es werden
auffällig viele behinderte Kinder geboren, unter Jugendlichen ist
Schilddrüsenkrebs weit verbreitet, die Anzahl der Krebserkrankungen unter
Erwachsenen ist enorm. Um zu verstehen, das dort vor sich geht, und zu
erahnen, wie es ist, dort zu leben, muss man es gesehen haben.
mag zwar nach Fukushima der Kernenergie den Rücken gekehrt haben, ist aber
von Ländern umgeben, in denen es auch weiterhin Atomkraftwerke gibt. Die
Frage nach dem Umgang mit ihren Abfällen, deren Transport und ihrer
Endlagerung kann nur lückenhaft beantwortet werden. In einigen Regionen
des 1986 bundesweit vom radioaktiven Fallout Tschernobyls am schlimmsten
betroffenen Freistaates Bayern sind Pilze und Wildschweine noch immer radioaktiv.
Es ist unvorstellbar, was mit uns geschehen würde, wenn sich in einem
unserer Nachbarländer ein atomarer Unfall ereignete – doch auch in
Tschernobyl, das weniger als 2.000 Kilometer von Frankfurt am Main
entfernt liegt, ist mit dem sich seit 2012 im Bau befindlichen neuen
Sarkophag die Gefahr nicht gebannt. Durch Projekte wie dieses werden die
Folgen des weltweit schwersten Unfalls in einem Kernkraftwerk 30 Jahre
später veranschaulicht und erlebbar, spürbar und nachvollziehbar gemacht.

If you don't know already, there are two salient characteristics about my life: (1) I'm broke and (2) I love taking pictures.
It's the Canon 6D. It's about as a good of a camera you can get, and I'm in love with it. Only problem is, I can't really afford it.
I bought my new camera on credit, and I'm kindly asking you guys to help me pay it off on time. In return, and in my way of thanking you, I will take your picture with it!

What it really comes down to is I (finally) decided to not let my financial situation keep me from doing what I love. After eight years of taking pictures, I came to the conclusion that a new camera is what will help me expand the scope of my photography.

If you have ever wanted me to take your picture, NOW IS THE TIME! Not only do I have an amazing new camera to do so, but I am also slashing my prices to 1/3-1/4 of what I usually charge! Please take a look at the various packages I have come up with.

Word of mouth is how I book 99% of my current shoots. Please refer my services to a friend or family member! It helps out a ton.

Official photography Facebook: [Here]
Official website: [Here]

I have a passion for photography and all things pin up! I love dressing up in vintage lingerie and taking photos. I would love to make some pin up posters, calendars, and other fun items for you!

The thing is I need a little help! I already have a camera but I want to make these top notch photos and for that to happen I need your help!

I need help with some funds for new lights as I do not own any, some sexy vintage props and lingerie. This would help make my photos really pop and would make them a lot of fun for you.

Of course no good deed goes unnoticed! Help me fund my project and you will receive prints and other fun goodies that I create!

I can wait to have some fun and make some really sexy pin up content for you!

Some days it feels like our world isn't as safe as it used to be. People get robbed on the street, burglar sneaks into our house from the back yard, or bikers get hit by the car behind them. What if we had an extra eye to watch our back knowing if we're being followed by someone on the street, or watch the bad drivers from the back of my bike? What if we could see who’s in the backyard or front door without showing ourselves?

Yes, we can solve them with a camera! But, the cameras we have are either huge or wired which makes them impossible to carry. Or they are power hungry and we have to charge battery multiple times each day. Eventually they became expensive high tech toys sitting inside the drawer.

We need something better! It has to be wireless and super small, easy to carry and can be installed anywhere. And it has to be super low power so that a single charge can run for a long time. That’s why we created WiCam.

History

We started work on WiCam in July 2015 and demonstrated the first working prototype at Maker Faire New York in September 2015. The reaction was nothing less than astounding. We met folks who want to use WiCam on their drone, inspired robot builders, and a bodyguard who was excited about wearable surveillance. Perhaps what inspired us most was kids' reaction who had some of the most imaginative ideas about what they do with WiCam. Everyone that has seen the prototype has asked when and where they can buy it. After month's of hard work, we're set to move from prototype to commercial availability.

A Tiny Coin Sized WiFi and Bluetooth camera that You Can Install Anywhere!

WiCam is different from other cameras. It was designed from the ground up to be tiny, use little power and be completely self-contained. Not much larger than a coin, you can put WiCam in your pocket and take it wherever you go!

Power Hungry?

It sucks when your camera went out of juice. Compared to regular cameras, WiCam consumes only 5% of the power used by a regular camera. That means it's not the usual camera you know or have. Super low power empowers WiCam with worry-free magic. Attach it and use it. Forget about wires, forget about daily charging.
WiCAM uses a 120 degree wide angle lens. You can attach WiCAM to the back of a bike and use it as a rear-view camera. WiCAM catches what you can’t see behind you and redisplays it on your smartphone.
Now you are assured that drivers behind you will do the right things when they know they’re being watched.

WiCam is not like a usual security camera that has to stay at home and connected to your router. WiCam is meant to be wild! You can connect to WiCam directly from your smartphone at any place. WiCam expands your vision and help you see what you can't see remotely.

WiCAM is ideal for replacing some of the security cameras - especially for yards, landscapes, farmlands and camping sites. Its battery can last for months and has a maximum of 30 meters distance wireless coverage in open areas.
You could also use WiCam outside the camping tent and watch the bear walking outside your tent from the WiCam, safely.

Wireless Camera on cars

WiCam can also be used on cars and watch any blind spots from your smartphone. WiCam streams video wirelessly to your smartphone without wiring in the front or back of your car.
Open Source, designed with Makers in mind!
WiCam is a state-of-the-art wireless video camera supporting Wifi and Bluetooth technology. With a rich API designed for Makers, this camera can quickly be integrated into almost any project.
WiCAM is made with makers in mind. It’s fully open documents and SDK could help you easily integrate WiCam into a Drone, a Robot, and many more.
WiCAM has a built in temperature sensor for smart home temperature monitoring! It also has an I2S audio interface allow you to incorporate wireless audio!
Design, change, minimize until what we have now, the miniaturized WiCAM.
• Battery: 500mAh Lithium polymer battery. Charge directly from USB port. (upgraded to 1000mAh battery on Mar 23, 2016)

Choose your Perks

There are three different mounting accessories you can choose for WiCam based on your needs.
If you like biking, pick the WiCam + Bike Mount option and use WiCam as a rearview camera.
If you need to install WiCam on metal surfaces, pick the WiCam + Magnetic mount option.
If you need to install WiCam on wood or concrete surfaces, pick WiCam + Adhesive mount option.
If you need more WiCams, and you missed all the Super Early Bird option. The Big Pack: 4 WiCams option is the best deal.
If you are a maker and would like to integrate WiCam into your project, pick the Developer Kit option. You get all the tools you need to integrate WiCam into your project.

Updates

[Mar 1st, 2016] Here's a demo of the WiCAM live video under low light condition and live streaming from iOS app.
Stretch Goal: Night vision lens + infrared light lamp + Solar charger

WiCam's first stretch goal is here! We added nigh vision camera lens and waterproof infrared light lamp so that you could use WiCam at night! We also added 1-watt waterproof solar charger so that you can really forget about wires and charging and use WiCam outdoors!

After the last 8 months of soldering, coding, hacking and iteration, WiCam is developed and in its finalize stages of refinement. Technical risks are very low at this stage since the hardware has been extensively tested and the software is nearly complete. With the technical challenges behind us, we are facing the challenge to bring WiCam into the hands of everyone. The only major risk that we are facing is to get the production volumes up in order to get the price down and that's why we are here for crowdfunding. 


We have established fantastic working relationships with component suppliers, PCBA and tooling factories to bring you the highest quality coin cam on time. However, unforeseen events such as other players on the market may purchase the same components in large volumes just the time before us. Getting the product in time to you is always one of our first priorities, and we keep close relationships with our component suppliers to make sure those critical components are buffered and reserved for our Kickstarter backers. If in case a delay were to occur, we will always keep all backers up to date, as we understand the importance of communication and we really want to share this entire experience with you all.

","Original Campaign is 387% funded on Kickstarter on April 15th, 2016.
Previous project updates can be found on the Kickstarter campaign. Future updates will be posted both Kickstarter and Indiegogo.

Some days it feels like our world isn't as safe as it used to be. People get robbed on the street, burglar sneaks into our house from the back yard, or bikers get hit by the car behind them. What if we had an extra eye to watch our back knowing if we're being followed by someone on the street, or watch the bad drivers from the back of my bike? What if we could see who’s in the backyard or front door without showing ourselves?

Yes, we can solve them with a camera! But, the cameras we have are either huge or wired which makes them impossible to carry. Or they are power hungry and we have to charge battery multiple times each day. Eventually they became expensive high tech toys sitting inside the drawer.

We need something better! It has to be wireless and super small, easy to carry and can be installed anywhere. And it has to be super low power so that a single charge can run for a long time. That’s why we created WiCam.

History We started work on WiCam in July 2015 and demonstrated the first working prototype at Maker Faire New York in September 2015. The reaction was nothing less than astounding. We met folks who want to use WiCam on their drone, inspired robot builders, and a bodyguard who was excited about wearable surveillance. Perhaps what inspired us most was kids' reaction who had some of the most imaginative ideas about what they do with WiCam. Everyone that has seen the prototype has asked when and where they can buy it. After month's of hard work, we're set to move from prototype to commercial availability.

A Tiny Coin Sized WiFi and Bluetooth camera that You Can Install Anywhere! WiCam is different from other cameras. It was designed from the ground up to be tiny, use little power and be completely self-contained. Not much larger than a coin, you can put WiCam in your pocket and take it wherever you go!

Power Hungry?It sucks when your camera went out of juice. Compared to regular cameras, WiCam consumes only 5% of the power used by a regular camera. That means it's not the usual camera you know or have. Super low power empowers WiCam with worry-free magic. Attach it and use it. Forget about wires, forget about daily charging.
WiCAM uses a 120 degree wide angle lens. You can attach WiCAM to the back of a bike and use it as a rear-view camera. WiCAM catches what you can’t see behind you and redisplays it on your smartphone.
Now you are assured that drivers behind you will do the right things when they know they’re being watched.
WiCam is born to be wild!

WiCam is not like a usual security camera that has to stay at home and connected to your router. WiCam is meant to be wild! You can connect to WiCam directly from your smartphone at any place. WiCam expands your vision and help you see what you can't see remotely.

WiCAM is ideal for replacing some of the security cameras - especially for yards, landscapes, farmlands and camping sites. Its battery can last for months and has a maximum of 30 meters distance wireless coverage in open areas.
You could also use WiCam outside the camping tent and watch the bear walking outside your tent from the WiCam, safely.

Wireless Camera on carsWiCam can also be used on cars and watch any blind spots from your smartphone. WiCam streams video wirelessly to your smartphone without wiring in the front or back of your car.
Open Source, designed with Makers in mind!
WiCam is a state-of-the-art wireless video camera supporting Wifi and Bluetooth technology. With a rich API designed for Makers, this camera can quickly be integrated into almost any project.
WiCAM is made with makers in mind. It’s fully open documents and SDK could help you easily integrate WiCam into a Drone, a Robot, and many more.
WiCAM has a built in temperature sensor for smart home temperature monitoring! It also has an I2S audio interface allow you to incorporate wireless audio!

column2: >This camera plate has all features you need – even your hand strap still fits your cam.

column4:
> 

 

The CP.01 gives you great freedom in the composition of your pictures and keeps your camera right where you want it. Bombproof. And the tripod mount is already included.

 

 

The CP.01 camery carrying system feels incredibly good from the first moment. Your cam rests bombproof in every position – without swinging or slipping. In the crucial moment, you will intuitively grab it.
column11:
s=159b49cf9c0ad05fd48daa1a84943fdd"" src=""""/>

 

 

No matter which setup you use, your camera always hangs perfectly.

 

 

In 25 years of professional experience we have often been annoyed by things that restrict our creative workflow. A slipping cam, an uncomfortable carrying position, or straps that block our view on the controls. That's why we sat down and rethought how to carry a camera.

 

 

The CP.01 shifts the camera center of gravity from top to base. The distance of the eyelets leads to a perfect balance – carrying the camera gets incredibly easy. Walking or cycling – no more annoying hinderances. The camera is part of your body and is still accessible anytime.
column18:
s=445a0af5f0fdfda0ffe3b25e0d26a7e6"" src=""""/>

 

 

The SPINN.DESIGN CP.01 is more than just a carrying system. It also effortlessly connects your camera to most tripods thanks to its already integrated Arca compatibility.
column25:
s=374446c37d08fadbee25b479e93b7ff2"" src=""""/> 

 

The CP.01 perfectly supports cameraman and women. It is the only camera carrying system that let you professionally work with an optical viewfinder in the video mode.

 

 
 

 

THE SPINN.DESIGN CP.01 is made to perfectly fit any DSLR or mirrorless camera through its reversable and slightly asymmetric design.

Features: 1) Recessed strap eyelets /// 2) Slip-proof rubber pads /// 3) Four attachment slots /// 4) Quick release tripod support with Arca-Swiss compatibility /// 5) Smooth edges for maximum comfort and perfect looks /// 6) Hand strap attachment slots /// Full protection of the camera base, no disruption of tilt-swivel displays

Specifications: overall length: 115 mm (4.5"") /// width: 38 mm/32 mm (1.5""/1.25"") /// weigth: 50 grams (1.75 oz) /// adjustment grid: (in shooting direction) stepless, (sideways) 4.5 mm (0.17"") /// CNC-machined from full aluminium and black anodized. 

 

 

Together with the extra long SPINN.DESIGN Heavy Duty Camera Strap, our system offers unprecedented comfort when carrying professional cameras. Of course you can also use any other strap together with the CP.01 camera plate.

 

 

This strap intentionally waives the so-called ""comfort features"" of others straps. It's ultra-light, feels great on your clothes and keeps your camera in a perfect position. This strap can handle any camera. Lightweight and reduced to what counts. Finely crafted by hand and tested to a maximum load of 75 kg (165 lbs). 

 

 

Features: Skin-friendly &
column26: smooth touch /// No stiff components scratching the camera body or yourself. Specifications: usable overall length: 140 cm (55"") /// width: 38 mm (1.5"") /// weigth: 44 grams (1.55 oz) /// maximum load: 75 Kg (165 lbs) /// Made of durable polyester yarn, triple stitched
column28:
>The CP.01 camera plate also works with every other strap.

 

We will manufacture this camera strap for you in Germany and offer it in different colors. In beautiful black, stylish olive-green, pink and sunflower-yellow.

 

 

It's also time for a new tool for photographers. Small, handy and most of all  in uncompromising quality. We believe that the SPINN.DESIGN photographer´s tool is the world's best tool for working on camera plates and tripods.

 

 

The axis symmetric design provides enormous torque with minimal finger force, and in comparison to other tools, the tool head is guided under tight control – no tilting, no pinching of fingers, no premature wear of screws. Attaching accessories now becomes incredibly comfortable. The photographer´s tool comes with a 4 mm (5/32"") allen wrench and a reasonably proportioned flat head tool.

 

 

The axis-symmetrical design not only provides enormous torque, but also lightning-fast operation.

Features: 1) Flat head tool tip with 10 mm (0.4"") width &
column29:
8 mm (0.32"") clearance /// 2) Attachment hole /// 3) Finger-friendly moulded shape /// 4) 4 mm (5/32"") allen wrench tool tip with 9 mm (0.35"") clearance

Specifications: height: 48 mm (1.9"") /// width: 50 mm  (2.0"") /// weigth: 10 grams (1.75 oz) /// tool heads: hardened tool  steel /// body: glass-fibre reinforced nylon

Meet HotDive. Your Favorite Diving Gear

Turn your smartphone into a professional underwater camera with fill light and an advanced dive computer. And that’s just to start.

Scuba Diving gear is expensive. Buying a diving computer, waterproof case, and underwater fill light is costly. It’s also a hassle carrying all that gear and diving with it.

 

HotDive takes your extra gear and puts it in an advanced, durable and depth tested phone case. It turns your smartphone into an all-in-one dive kit, acting as a dive computer, a fill light, camera and so much more. And with a built-in air vacuum system you can bring your phone to depths as low as 80m. HotDive offers deep savings (money, time, space, and weight) while letting you explore and capture the beauty of the underwater world.

Take crystal clear, professional photos of your deep dives with HotDive.
column2: /> Enjoy unrivalled clarity as you make lasting memories on every dive.

column1:
Smart Automatic Air Pump System 

Enjoy no foggy or blurry images! Taking a clear photo at depth isn’t easy. Hot plugs and desiccants can help, but they don’t actually create the optimal vacuum. HotDive’s case uses an independent auto-pump air extraction system creating a perfect vacuum for your smartphone.
 

This means that every photo or video you take will be crystal clear without any fear of fog obscuring the wonders of the sea!

Take crystal clear photos at any depth without fear of fog

Powerful Fill Light For Any Depth

The deeper your dives, the less light there is. Meaning if you want to see the wonders hiding under the waves you need to bring light. HotDive is equipped with a powerful fill light to create optimal conditions for your photos.
column2:
/>

High Range Color Capture

HotDive is perfect for underwater photos or even night diving. Using American CREE LED lights with 130°illuminance and 5800-6500K (closest to the sun’s rays) color temperature, HotDive creates the perfect lighting conditions for photos and videos. This effect brings the true color of the underwater world to life, as it offers 800 Lumens of intense light. 

Built-In Dive Computer

Dive computers are a key piece of safety equipment for all divers. They help prevent accidents by measuring depth, dive duration, and ascending speed. The HotDive Pro, the advanced version of the HotDive, uses a built-in computer that acts as an all-in-one solution.

HotDive Pro’s computer uses a Nordic Semiconductor ultra-low power consumption (ULP) wireless chip for fast processing speed and in-depth monitoring. Its high capability is made better with low power consumption and a stronger signal to ensure a smooth connection to your smartphone. HotDive Pro also uses a Swiss TE MS5083 depth sensor to monitor real-time depth, calculate ascent speed, and issue warnings. And it also has a built-in compass, so you always know which direction you’re diving in.
column3:
/>

Smart Tech Keeps You Safe

Thanks to an advanced dive computer, HotDive Pro is made with your safety in mind. It calculates depth and time spent diving so it can inform you when the safety stop required.

When it detects that the depth stress has reached 5 meters it will sound an alarm by vibrating to remind you to stay underwater for 3 minutes before ascending to the surface.

column1:
Taking photos with HotDive is simple and easy. Using professional software designed for underwater environments, HotDive lets you take photos or videos, switch between the front and rear cameras with the press of one button.

You can even preview your photos and videos with just 1 click!
column3:
Freediving Mode

 

The HotDive App works with the HotDive Pro and can be set to two modes: scuba diving and freediving. These modes are only available on the HotDive Pro due to its built-in dive computer.

 

Scuba diving mode is able to show real-time depth, maximum depth,  current temperature, and current diving time. It also allows you to set a maximum depth vibration reminder, maximum diving time vibration reminder, and vibration reminder when the ascent speed is too fast. This function is very helpful for both first-time divers and professional divers.

Freediving mode can set 5 different depth vibration and surface time vibration reminders.

Thanks to the exclusive sturdy design, you can use HotDive for both snorkeling(0-10m) and freediving(10m-80m). The real-time depth and dive time displayed on the screen allows you to take photos &
column4:
videos while knowing how deep you are and how long your current dive time is. 

Thanks to the built-in 800 lumens fill light HotDive allows you to do a quick snorkeling night dive near your beach resort before sleeping. Isn't it nice to post some octopus photos and wake up with a lot of likes on your social media channel?

What People Are Saying About HotDive

column1: Filmed footage by iPhone 12 with the HotDive Pro

HotDive’s app lets you log your dives automatically by connecting to your phone and auto-syncing your photos and videos. It lets you view real-time results and even share your diving status at any time! 

The photos &
column2: videos are actually stored in your smartphone instead of the HotDive. This can save you a lot of time to enjoy your dives.
/> 3500ma Battery That Lasts Your Entire Dive

column1:
HotDive powers your dives with a powerful battery. It offers you 15-20 days of power without using the fill light and 100 minutes of continuous power while using the fill light. You don't need to bother charging it all the time!

HotDive Works With Your Favorite Devices

HotDive is compatible with every iPhone and Android phone – as long as the size is smaller than 168mm(6.6inch) x 84mm(3.3inch)(exclude the smartphones with pop-up camera ) and has Bluetooth. (HotDive controls your phone via iPhone or Android apps) 

Even if you change your phone regularly, HotDive will always be a good buddy with your new phones. This will save you tremendous money and hassle.
column2:
/>

If you are unable to use the HotDive app on your smartphone (or if it’s incompatible) please email us and our team will assist you and we will update the app.

 

Wrist Strap For Easy Use

Built with a handy wrist strap, HotDive is always close at hand without interfering with your diving. It also lets you use your hands when you’re not taking photos or shining the fill light!
column3:
/>

Made To Withstand The Depths

HotDive is made from one whole piece of aluminum alloy that is precisely cut by CNC machines. It is made to withstand the pressures of the depths and keep your smartphone safe. 

The exclusive mechanical design of HotDive guarantees the full seal of the case once the vacuum is completed which makes it impossible to leak while diving. The compact of the material and the inner vacuum contribute it to be waterproof for a depth of up to 80 meters. That's more than enough for recreational scuba diving and freediving. So, you should feel safe to put your smartphone inside the HotDive case and start recording your adventures. 

Make It Your Own with Lenses

HotDive is made to adapt to your needs. That’s why we made it work with lenses you can pick up at your local camera store or online. If you want a macro lens or a wide lens, you can pick it up and attach it to the HotDive discovering more possibilities for photography.

An App Does The Work For You 

The HotDive app lets you use all its functions offline. Meaning you can review your photos instantly with no internet connection!

 Tech Specs 

What You’ll Get​

 

Operation Demonstration

column1:
HotDive Production Process ​

Meet The People Behind HotDive

Yiwu Bubble Network Technology Co., Ltd. was established in May 2015. We specialize in producing marine diving equipment. Our team came together because of our love of diving. We travel around the world every year to dive together in new dive sites. This brought us to create HotDive, the professional smart diving all-in-one smart diving kit. We have always worked to create quality and innovative equipment to enhance the diving experience. And we will continue to carry out technological innovations for HotDive in the hope that HotDive will be a part of your next diving trip and will help you reach new depths.

You can find all the information you need about HotDive in our media kit below. If you have specific questions please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at team@hotdive.cn
